The order had sparked concerns among industry players who felt the government would auction land without creating necessary infrastructure for new industries or commercial units. Rane appears to have paid heed to these concerns raised by the private sector as several industry players, including Goa Chamber of Commerce and Industry (GCCI) president, Manoj Caculo and Goa State Industries Association (GSIA) president, Damodar Kochkar feature on the monitoring committee.

Title: Admin demolishes boundary wall of Azam’s university, gives farmers access to their land
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Rampur: Rampur district administration on Thursday demolished a portion of the boundary wall of Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan’s Jauhar University, which was allegedly raised illegally on government land, to provide a passage to the farmers to their land on the university campus.

According to the district administration, the demolition was carried out amid tight security provided by local police after the university authorities failed to demolish illegal structures raised on around 17 bighas of government land despite a notice was served to them on February 15.

Azam Khan, his wife Tanzeen Fatimah and their son Abdullah Azam were not present in Rampur when the demolition was carried out. The MP and his wife and son — both MLAs — have been declared “absconders” by a local court, which also issued non-bailable warrants against them.

Aunjaneya Kumar Singh, who recently got an extension for one year as Rampur district magistrate, told TOI, “We are only complying with the order of the UP revenue board, which directed the administration to remove all encroachments from the village Chak road, a portion of which falls on the university campus. The boundary wall was raised on the land illegally occupied by the university. It was preventing farmers from approaching their land that falls on the university campus. And thus, a portion of the boundary wall was demolished to give the farmers access to their land.”

“We have given the university authorities three days to demolish all illegal structures. A notice was served, too, on February 15, but they failed to act. It’s better if they act themselves and remove encroachments as we don’t want the police force to enter the campus and affect the studies,” said the DM.

On Thursday afternoon, a heavy police force was deployed outside the university campus and the demolition was carried out in the presence of sub-divisional magistrate Prem Prakash Tiwari and other administrative officials. After the demolition, the village Chak road was opened for the farmers, said the DM.

“Since the university authorities failed to comply with the notice, they would have to bear the expenses incurred on the demolition,” added the DM.

According to the district administration, a portion of the medical college, science faculty and the vice-chancellor’s lodge — all erected illegally on 17 bighas of government land — will be demolished.

In 2007, then chief minister Mayawati had directed then Rampur DM Ram Sanjevan to demolish the boundary wall of Jauhar University to clear the road, which connects to Aliyaganj village near the university.

In August 2019, the boundary wall of Humsafar resort belonging to Abdullah Azam was demolished by the district administration, claiming that it was illegally built on government land.

Title: Maharashtra delegation meets Jagan, hails Disha Act initiative
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Vijayawada: Maharashtra home minister Anil Deshmukh along with a police delegation held a meeting with state DGP Gautam Sawang and home minister M Sucharita on Thursday to study the implementation of the Disha Act in Andhra Pradesh.

The delegation also met chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy and hailed the Andhra Pradesh government’s initiative to enact the Disha Act which aims to fast-track crimes against women and children with the provision of death penalty.

Deshmukh said the Maharashtra government too plans to bring in a similar legislation. “We have gathered full information about the Disha Act, police stations and other initiatives by the Andhra Pradesh government. We too plan to bring out something similar soon,” he said.

Home minister Sucharita said the Act was the first-of-its-kind in the country and the state government has so far earmarked Rs 87 crore for effective implementation of the law. “Under the Act, 13 special courts are being set up, besides a control room and one-stop centres to aid women and children in distress,” Sucharita said.

Elaborating on the progress made so far, chief secretary Nilam Sawhney said IAS officer Kritika Shukla and IPS officer Deepika Patil have been appointed exclusively to oversee the implementation of the Disha Act. Both Kritika and Deepika also gave an elaborate presentation to the Maharashtra delegation.

The AP legislature, during its winter session in December last year, passed the bill to amend the Indian Penal Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure to enable expeditious investigation and trial of offences against women and children, especially sexual offences, and award of death penalty.

Title: Railways mulls MEMU train in ghat
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: Central Railway is mulling the possibility of running Mainline Electrical Multiple Unit (MEMU) trains from Kalyan to Nashik, across the Kasara ghat. The rail division has written to the Research Design and Standards Organisation (RDSO) in Lucknow requesting it to explore the potential of MEMU trains on the route.

The move comes after a recent meeting between Nashik MP Hemant Godse and general manager of Central Railway. Godse is believed to have discussed a quick shuttle-like train service between Nashik and Kalyan.

It has been nearly two years since reports first emerged of the launch of Electrical Multiple Unit (EMU) trains — also known as ‘locals’ — between Nashik and Kalyan.

In the ghat sections, trains need to have bankers (additional engines) at the rear while ascending or descending steep gradients. An RDSO clearance is required for that. But railway engineers flagged the project saying tunnels along the Kasara ghat section were not wide enough for the wide-bodied EMU. Engineers warned that passengers’ lives could be at risk. The Railways then dropped the idea of Kalyan-Igatpuri EMU operations. According to officials, the RDSO could conduct MEMU trials as its cars are of regular width.

Title: Hike in toilet fees to pinch users
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: The next time you feel an urgency and spot a pay and use toilet nearby, ensure your pocket is full too. For, the Rajkot Municipal Corporation (RMC) on Thursday has decided to increase user charges for municipal lavatories from Rs 2 to 5. The standing committee has also given its approval for increased user charges.

Use of RMC toilets are free for women and children, while for the males, only the use of urinal is free.

RMC operates 137 toilets in the city, of which 77 are pay and use and 60 are free. Three toilets are out of order. The civic body plans to construct 55 more toilets in the near future.

When contacted, RMC environment engineer Nilesh Parmar said, “We have outsourced the toilets’ operation and maintenance to agencies who do not have to pay us anything, but maintain the toilet, pay salary of a person and electricity bill on their own. Keeping price rise in view they requested us to hike fees as it has become difficult for them to recover operational costs.”

Title: Cartilage from knee helps US national, 69, walk without pain
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A procedure to transplant healthy cartilage from the knee along with bio-active material through a keyhole surgery by doctors at a city hospital has helped a 69-year-old school teacher walk without pain.

On Thursday, Sarah Hassler, a US national , told reporters that the pain in her knees restricted her from performing day-to-day activities at school. Doctors at the Apollo Hospitals on Old Mahabalipuram Road told her that the increasing knee pain was due to osteoarthritis. Conventionally, most patients are advised knee replacement surgeries. Though it would ensure a pain-free life, it may restrict patients from activities such as jogging, squatting and playing.

Doctors decided to use the Hassler “one-step minced cartilage procedure” which would save her natural joint. “Usually, surgery for cartilage repair is a two-step process involving autologous chondrocyte implantation (ACI),” said Dr Madhan Thiruvengada, the hospital’s robotic joint replacement surgeon. For such surgeries, patients’ cartilage cells are harvested and grown in the lab for upto 6 weeks. The patient then undergoes the second procedure for implanting the grown cartilage tissue. “We do this in one step. A portion of a healthy cartilage from the patient’s knee is harvested and used. It reduces recovery time. There is no use of chemical agents during the procedure,” he said. Hassler was discharged in a day and has been on an international vacation since the surgery, he said.

Title: Jackky Bhagnani and Nawazuddin Siddiqui starrer 'Carbon' receives 'Dadasaheb Phalke Award' for the Best Short Film
Content: Jackky Bhagnani's short film 'Carbon' received a lot of appreciation and love from the audience. The Hindi science-fiction film was focused on the issue of global warming.The movie is set in 2067, on earth where carbon is the gas in abundance, oxygen has become one of the most expensive commodity and there is a dearth of clean drinking water due to climate change!Jackky plays a man with an artificial heart and Nawazzudin Siddiqui plays the role of a man from Mars.The film has been awarded the coveted Dadasaheb Phalke Award under the best short film category.“Carbon deals with serious environmental issues like global warming and climate change, and their impact on our world. Carbon is an attempt at creating awareness. As an actor and producer, the only way I know how to communicate with audiences is through films. I am truly humbled to receive this honour especially for a film that contributes to issues relevant to today's day and age and climate change is an issue that needs immediate attention", said Jackky Bhagnani Jackky is producing Varun Dhawan and Sara Ali Khan's next 'Coolie No. 1' which has been slated for May 2020 release.

Title: Counsel talks of court's mood, gets adjournment
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

CHANDIGARH: To the long list of reasons why adjournments are sought has been added a particularly unusual one: "The mood of the court is bad this morning."

This uncommon adjournment happened on February 4 in the Punjab and Haryana high court, where a lawyer arguing a civil revision petition apparently felt he didn't stand much of a chance after seeing Justice Rajiv Narain Raina dismiss the first four cases of the day, "one after the other".

Justice Raina accepted counsel KS Sidhu's plea for an adjournment, albeit after clarifying that the four cases he had dismissed back-to-back deserved to be treated so. "The counsel, assuming the mood of the court is bad this morning [due to] dismissing of first four urgent cases one after the other... prays that time may be granted to him to argue the case some other day. I grant permission for an adjournment, but not without saying that those cases were not worth admission," he said.

In 2018, Raina had granted an adjournment in a civil suit after he was informed that the counsel representing one of the parties was newly married and would prefer to argue the case some other day.

The same year, Raina asked the Haryana government not to create hurdles in inter-faith marriages. He observed that seeking certain information during registration of marriages under the Special Marriage Act was tantamount to violation of privacy.

Title: 2 held for setting worker on fire
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Pune: A construction contractor and a foreman were arrested on Wednesday on the charge of setting a worker on fire because he was pursuing them for his salary, due for the past three months.

The worker, Subhash Sahu (33), suffered 40% burns. His right hand and leg burnt in the incident. He is undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Kalewadi Phata.

The incident occurred on February 3 but Sahu, currently residing at Tathawade, lodged an FIR only on Wednesday because the duo had had threatened him with dire consequences. Sahu has his roots in Bihar.

A Hinjewadi police team led by assistant inspector Uddhav Khade took the contractor, Mohammed Zumratiya (40) of Tapkirnagar, and foreman Santoshkumar Harakram (36) of Tathawade into custody late on Wednesday night. They have been charged under sections 307 (murder attempt) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code.

Khade said while getting admitted to the hospital, Sahu had told the doctors around 4pm on February 3 that he saw a snake along the service road near his construction site. “In an attempt to save himself, he accidentally touched a live wire and suffered burns. No one suspected him and began the treatment,” Khade said, quoting the hospital authorities.

He said the hospital authorities approached the police on Wednesday after Sahu told them that he was set on fire. “We then recorded his statement,” Khade said.

Sahu in his statement said, “When I again demanded money, contractor Zumratiya and foreman Harakram pour petrol on me outside the site and set me on fire.”

He said Sahu also alleged in his complaint that while admitting him in the hospital, the duo had pressurised him to give false statement to the doctors and threatened to kill him. “After his relatives came from Bihar, he gathered courage and recorded his statement,” Khade said.

“We shall take medico-legal opinion to find out whether Sahu’s burn injuries were due to electric shock or petrol,” Khade added.

Title: Muslims, cops welcome kanwarias in Sambhal
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Bareilly: A group of kanwarias on Thursday arrived in Sambhal amid warm welcome by Muslim residents and police to offer Gangjal to Lord Shiva on the occasion of Maha Shivratri on Friday.

Muslim residents not only welcomed kanwarias by offering them fruits but also extended their helping hands in lifting the kanwars of the tired devotees.

Superintendent of police Yamuna Prasad said, “Kanwarias are bringing Gangajal from different ghats of neighbouring Budaun and Sambhal districts and Uttarakhand’s Haridwar, which they will offer to Lord Shiva at temples in their villages on the occasion of Maha Shivratri. It is nice to see Muslims welcoming kanwarias by showering flowers and offering fruits to them. Such gestures promote communal harmony.”

Meanwhile, president of BJP district minority cell Sayed Shaan Ali said it was an honour for them to welcome kanwarias. “We have started a camp in service to kanwarias bringing Gangajal after travelling several kilometres. Today, the SP inaugurated our camp by cutting the ribbon,” he added.

Title: 2 criminals arrested for over 20 burglaries
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Pune: Analysing CCTV cameras and studying modus operandi of burglars helped the Wanowrie police arrest two criminals on Wednesday and detect 21 cases, including burglaries at three jewellery stores and vehicle thefts from 2018.

Police seized 109.27kg silver, 200g gold, four cars and two motorcycles valued at over Rs1 crore from the arrested duo — Tilaksingh Tak (28) and Jaisingh alias Pillusingh Juni (26) from Ramtekdi and Vaiduwadi. Bandu Waghmare (35) from Hadapsar was also taken into custody for receiving the stolen loot from the criminals.

The police launched investigations into a burglary case lodged with the Wanowrie police on February 3. They analysed footage from 34 CCTV cameras capturing images of Tak and Juni, involved in stealing ornaments from jewellery stores at Wakad, Chinchwad and Sinhagad Road, among other places.

Acting on a tip-off, a police team comprising Nasir Deshmukh and Navnath Khatal, under senior inspector Krantisinh Patil, arrested Tak and Juni.

Senior inspector Patil said in a statement, “Tak and Juni admitted to their involvement in a string of burglaries registered with the Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad police commissionerate, and the Pune rural police from 2018. They have also spit out the names of their two accomplices on the run during questioning.”

The police said the suspects would steal vehicles and use them for committing burglaries at jewellery stores and other places at night. They would abandon the vehicles after exhausting the fuel or if they developed technical snags.

“We have also seized a screw driver, crowbar, three scissors and five duplicate keys from the criminals. A team under inspector Salim Chaus has launched a hunt for arresting the criminals on the run,” Patil said in the statement.

Title: Indore: One of vehicle lifting gang nabbed after dramatic chase
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

The item recovered from possession of arrested

INDORE: After a dramatic series of events at a temporary picket, police on Thursday arrested a man believed to be a member of vehicle lifters gang and seized hi-tech equipment used for unlocking digital locks from his car in Kishanganj late on Wednesday. Two SUVs accompanying the car got away during encounter.

Though empty cartridges were found from the spot, officials claimed that there was no firing from either side during the encounter.

SP West Mahesh Chandra Jain said that they had stationed four teams comprising 12 officials from four police stations including Juni Indore , Bhanwarkuan, Rajendra Nagar and Annapurna near a lane in Kishanganj, where the incident took place.

“Head constable Mahesh Chouhan, who was in one of the police vehicles, saw three vehicles approaching. He got down and tried to stop them but driver of vehicle in the front hit him and tried to flee the spot,” said Jain.

He added that as other officials saw that Chouhan was injured, they rushed to his rescue while one of the constables tried to stop the accused by parking his vehicle in front of the hatchback.

The two SUVs, however, managed to maneuver and flee the spot as the first vehicle was caught by officials present on the spot.

The other two teams also reached there and tried to follow the accused but were not able to do so.

“We have seized some hi-tech equipment from arrested accused, who identified himself as RN Khan, and an identification card has also been seized from him but it is being checked if it is true,” said SP Jain.

Officials believe that gang members are from Uttar Pradesh and had a nexus in MP too.

“The equipment including key maker, hammers, screws and sharp weapons suggest that they are members of some hardcore criminal gang,” said ASP Rajesh Vyas adding that an internet dongle has been recovered and he told them that they only made internet calls so it was almost impossible to track them.

Officials said that the accused has been arrested and he is being interrogated on crimes committed by them in state and elsewhere.

Title: Munirka Building Tilting: Building tilts in Munirka, 45 evacuated
Content:
The five-storey building, which was leaning towards one side, in Munirka area of Delhi. (PTI Photo)

NEW DELHI: It was found that a six-storey building in south Delhi’s Munirka had tilted on Thursday, officials said. It is situated in front of Jawaharlal Nehru University’s north gate.As soon as the issued was reported at 5.30am, Delhi Police evacuated all 45 tenants living in the building. People living in nearby buildings were also told to evacuate for safely. To look into the matter, teams of South Delhi Municipal Corporation and National Disaster Response Force, along with the sub divisional magistrate also reached the spot immediately, police said.An SDMC official said that the building was identified as dangerous and mentioned in the list of ‘Dangerous Buildings Survey.’In Video: Delhi: 6-storey building tilts in Munirka, 45 evacuated

Title: One arrested for stealing sandalwood
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: The city police have arrested one person for allegedly stealing sandalwood trees. The police suspect that a gang is operating in the city that is identifying, felling and stealing the sandalwood trees in Nashik.

Last week, police beat marshals S K Shinde and V L Mohite were on their regular patrolling duty, when they noticed two motorcycle-borne people moving around suspiciously at 1.30 am near a school. The beat marshals asked them to stop but instead, the driver accelerated the vehicle and tried to flee.

During the chase, the police noticed a saw-like instrument with the two suspects. When the police finally waylaid them, they arrested Mukhtarkhan Mohammed Hanif Khan Pathan, 32, a resident of Jalna but his accomplice managed to flee.

Pathan has told the police that there were three others illegally cutting sandalwood trees. He was remanded in police custody.

Title: Directorate of education advises sharing of textbooks: Lighter school bags
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: To help further reduce the burden of heavy school bags, the directorate of education (DoE) has asked schools to allow two students to share one textbook.

DoOE director Vandana Rao has said that schools can also maintain a spare set of textbooks for students to use.

“Minimise the need to bring textbooks for certain subjects by covering the course material in the class,” the circular issued said. Schools have been asked to follow the instructions to avoid ‘adverse effects of heavy school bags’ on students.

“Use audio-visual methods in the class rather than having the students refer to a textbook,” Rao has said.

In November 2019, backed by rising complaints of back and neck pain among school children in the state, the state government’s victim assistance unit (VAU) had demanded clear-cut guidelines for reducing the weight of school bags.

As per DoE’s earlier guidelines, the weight of a school bag should not exceed 10% of the body weight of the child.

Teachers have been told to “pre-inform students about books, notebooks to be carried in a particular day.”

Title: Lions roaming inside VCT? Don’t panic, pics are fake
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Fake image alert: This and other photographs were circulating on social media with the message that lions have... Read More

Visakhapatnam: Panic broke out across the city after a number of photographs showing a lion attacking a person at Visakha Container Terminal (VCT) went viral on social media platforms. Responding to it, officials of the VCT put out a statement on Thursday stating that the photographs have no connection with the Visakhapatnam port.

A VCT spokesperson said, “There was a viral message on WhatsApp stating that there were lions in the container terminal area of Visakhapatnam port and a person had been attacked. The images have no relation with Visakhapatnam.”

In their clarification, VCT officials said that the images doing the rounds on social media are from Port Pipavav located in Amreli district located around 78km from Diu in Gujarat. Lions are known to frequent the area often, they said.

“A few photographs went viral showing bulk containers in the backdrop. Imposters convinced people that the photographs are from the container terminal of Visakhapatnam port,” said an official.

Officials of the forest department said that the question of wild lions roaming in and around Visakhapatnam does not arise. “There is no lion population in north Andhra,” said D Nalini Mohan, the principal chief conservator of forests.

Title: Youth arrested for raping 15-yr-old in Shahjahanpur
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Bareilly: A 20-year-old youth was on Thursday arrested for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl in a village in Shahjahanpur on Wednesday evening.

Police said when the girl was on her way to market, the accused, a resident of the same village, took her to a public toilet and raped her.

Before fleeing the scene, the youth threatened the girl of dire consequences if she revealed the matter, said police.

After returning home, the girl narrated her ordeal to her family. After receiving a complaint, an FIR was registered against the accused under section 376 (rape) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. Police sent the girl for a medical examination.

Station house officer of Banda police station Rajbahadur Singh said, “We have arrested the accused on Thursday. He was sent to jail.”

Title: Police seize stolen car from duo in custody
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Pune: The Kondhwa police seized the stolen car from two youths on Thursday, two days after they were arrested for threatening its driver with sharp weapons and stealing it on NIBM-Undri Road.

The Two men had threatened the car driver with sharp weapons and stole his vehicle, as well as some cash, just after he had got a flat tyre repaired near a hotel on the NIBM-Undri Road around 10.30pm on Monday.

Using CCTV footage, the Kondhwa police had arrested Vishal Avhad (19), a criminal on record, and his friend, Sharukh Khan (25), both residents of Krishnanagar.

During questioning, the police said, Avhad and Khan admitted that they had threatened the driver, Akshay Khude (25) from Yeolewadi, with the weapons and stolen the car. They had also robbing him of some cash.

Assistant inspector Chetan More from the Kondhwa police said, “We have seized the car parked by the suspects in a jungle at Mohammadwadi in Kondhwa. We also recovered Rs300 belonging to the driver and the knife the duo had used to threaten him with dire consequences.”

More said, “Avhad and Khan told the police that they had also stolen three vehicles from various places in Kondhwa. We seized an autorickshaw and two motorcycles they had left in the jungle. They used tp steal vehicles to earn some quick money.”

On Monday evening, the car owner was on her way to Corianthans Club at Mohammadwadi to attend her daughter’s marriage ceremony when her vehicle got a puncture. She parked the car near a restaurant around 7.30pm and called up Khude, her part-time driver, asking him to repair the puncture. She proceeded for the ceremony in an autorickshaw.

When Khude came to the spot and got the tyre repaired, he was accosted by the duo. They snatched his cash and the car keys. One of them started the car and told Khude to sit next to him. When the car reached near Corianthans Club, Khude applied the hand brake, stepped out of the car and raised an alarm. The robber, however, released the brake, got his accomplice to sit in the car and sped off from the spot.

Title: Two robbers held in murder, loot case
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Two robbers were arrested on Thursday in a murder and loot case reported from Kanbivas locality of Bhavnagar December 19 last year.

Police said the accused, identified as Vipul Soni and his minor accomplice, stabbed Dilip Patel (65) when Patel resisted them. After killing Patel, they looted cash, cellphone, gold and silver jewellery worth Rs 1.38 lakh.

“We identified the cellphone numbers that were active on the night of December 19 near the spot of the crime. We have kept the mobile number on surveillance and traced the number in Vadodara. Tracking the mobile networks, finally we have rounded up Soni from Vadodara. During interrogation, Soni broke down and confessed to have committed the crime and also revealed the name of his minor aide as the co-accused,” said Manish Thakar , Bhavnagar deputy superintendent of police.

Patel’s son Vishal and wife Harsha were in Surat on the day of the crime. Vishal used to work as a diamond polisher while Patel used to work in a shop selling paints.

Title: Another crocodile rescued from Veda
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

It was release in Omkareshwar Dam after medical check up

KHARGONE: The forest department rescued a crocodile from Veda river under Kasrawad forest range of Khargone district on Thursday. Khargone divisional forest officer (DFO) JS Bhargav told TOI that a 2.72 m-long female crocodile was caught from Veda river near Lepa village. It was brought to Kasrawad forest office for a medical check-up and after finding it in a healthy condition, they released it in a dam at Omkareshwar.

There is a possibility of more crocodiles in the area, he said.

Villagers on early Thursday saw the crocodile at the bank of Veda river and informed police and forest officials.

On February 17, another crocodile was rescued from Veda river near village Rangaon.

Title: City to have medical college by 2020-21
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: Public health and family welfare minister Rajesh Tope said on Thursday that the government plans to start a medical college in the city in 2020-21, and the construction of the college will be carried out simultaneously.

“Having a medical college in a city like Nashik is very important. To strengthen quality and quantity of the public health service in the city, we plan to start the first course in the 2020-21 itself. It will be held on the Maharashtra University Health Sciences (MUHS) campus to begin with,” Tope, who was on a day’s tour in Nashik, said.

Tope visited the referral hospital in the city and the district civil hospital. Appreciating the services rendered by the staff and the professionals in these hospitals, the minister said that the government wants to make available maximum numbers of medical professionals like these for its own sources so that the health of people is taken care of.

Despite being the revenue headquarters and an important trade centre of the North Maharashtra region, the city does not have a government medical college.

“Medical college is the most important asset for the state as well as the country as it brings quality treatment at affordable costs for needy patients. It also helps in producing good quality doctors. The state government will go to any lengths to ensure that we start a medical college in the city in 2020-21,” Tope said.

“The chief minister, deputy chief minister, district guardian minister, medical education minister and all of us will make every budgetary provision for starting a medical college in the city,” Tope added.

Title: SC order a black day for Goa: Cong
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Panaji: Congress said the Supreme Court’s order was a black day for Goa. The BJP government and chief minister Pramod Sawant have executed the “sale deed of Mother Mhadei in favour of Karnataka,” said Congress president Girish Chodankar. “We will now intensify agitation against the government,” said opposition leader Digambar Kamat. tnn

Title: Madras HC stays recruitment for 8,888 firemen posts
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Thursday ordered an interim stay in the recruitment of more than 8,000 posts in Tamil Nadu fire and rescue services in response to a petition that sought a CBI probe into alleged malpractices in the recruitment by Tamil Nadu Uniformed Services Recruitment Board (TNUSRB).

Expressing displeasure, Justice N Anand Venkatesh, before whom the petition came up, observed that people will lose confidence in the state if there is fraud in every public service examination.

As many as 15 people had moved the court seeking probe by the central agency even as ripples created by the TNPSC recruitment scam are yet to settle down in the state.

“About 1,019 candidates have been selected from Vellore district and another 763 were chosen from exam centres in Villupuram. All of these candidates were declared to have secured more than 72 marks in the exam. Most of those selected from Vellore are from Sigaram Tuition Centre,” according to the petition.

A notification was issued by TNUSRB in 2019 for filling 8,888 vacant posts of grade-II constables, firemen and jail wardens. Written exams were conducted on August 25 last year and physical examination and endurance tests were held in November 2019.

According to the petitioners, the board published a provisional selection list on February 4 in which their names did not feature, though they had cleared the written exam and physical test. The petitioners contended that most of the candidates selected had secured 69 marks and the highest seems to be 88 marks by a candidate for the post of fireman. Expressing shock that cut-off marks were not published for any category, the petitioners sought the court’s intervention in the matter.

Besides irregularities in the selection process, 20% reservation for people who studied in Tamil medium has not been provided in the recruitment, the petitioners said.

The petitioners had wanted the court to call for the records of the provisional list and quash the same besides ordering a CBI probe into the alleged irregularities.

As an interim relief, the 15 petitioners had requested the court to direct the board to produce their OMR answer sheets.

On Thursday, when the petition came up for hearing, Justice N Anand Venkatesh ordered that the entire selection shall be kept in abeyance for a period of one week considering the allegations made. Directing the recruiting body to respond on the matter, the court adjourned the petition to March 5.

Title: Three held with stolen items worth Rs 5 Lakh
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Cops with the accused

INDORE: Rajendra Nagar police on Thursday busted a gang of thieves and arrested three persons, who committed eight thefts in the city, and seized stolen items worth Rs five lakh from them.

ASP Manish Khatri said that they had received a tip-off, acting on which a raid was conducted and accused Ranjeet Panwar, Dinesh Patidar and a watchman Bharat Chouhan were arrested and booked under relevant sections of the IPC. The accused said that they conducted a recce of different townships in the city and then committed the thefts. Accused Bharat Chouhan worked as a guard at Silicon City township. He was involved in smuggling spurious liquor in the city.

Ranjeet Panwar, 24, is a drug addict and in order to get money to purchase drugs, he started stealing. Six cases have been registered against him at various police stations and he was lodged in jail.

Dinesh Patidar is a mechanic and he was arrested for illegally transporting arms. Eight cases have been registered against him at various police stations.

Rajendra Nagar police station in charge Sunil Sharma said that the accused were being questioned and there was a possibility that police would get leads about more crimes.

Title: Biker booked for drunk, negligent driving
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: A motorcyclist has been booked by the city police for drunk and negligent driving leading to an accident.

The suspect and his friend, who was riding pillion on the motorcycle, have sustained injuries in the accident. An officer from Sarkarwada police station said the 21-year-old accused is a resident of Guru Kripa Vijay Nagar in Sinnar town.

“He lost the control of his two-wheeler near the Canada Corner and hit the divider and fell down. The suspect received injuries on his leg while his friend got away with bruises,” a police officer said.

“The motorcyclist has been booked for injuring himself and his friend, for loss to property and drunk and negligent driving,” he added.

In another case, two people got injured when the motorcycle they were riding was hit by another two-wheeler near Makhmalabad village on Wednesday.

Sudhir Kumawat (36) was riding the motorcycle while his friend Popat Pradhan was riding pillion. The incident occurred at 4.45 pm. The driver of the other two-wheeler fled the scene. Police have booked him under various sections for negligent driving.

In a third incident, a biker was injured when the motorcycle he was riding on was hit by a car near the Army Aviation Corps gate on the Nashik Pune road.

The complainant, Ramesh Sutar (39), a resident Cidco, was waiting near the road divider in front of the Army Aviation Gate to cross the road on Sunday night when the car coming from Nashik Road his two-wheeler.

Title: Government played into Karnataka’s hands: Goa Forward Party
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

GFP president Vijai Sardesai

PANAJI: Goa Forward Party said the state government had played into Karnataka’s hands. “Reliably known that Karnataka prayed to go-ahead for gazette notification of Mhadei Tribunal order.

Goa didn’t object! And played into hands of Karnataka which can now officially go ahead with Kalasa-Bhandura project,” said GFP president Vijai Sardesai .

Title: 9-year-old girl found dead in Kheri, rape suspected
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Bareilly: The body of a nine-year-old girl, who had gone missing on Wednesday evening, was found in a sugarcane field on Thursday in a village under Mirzapur police station of Lakhimpur Kheri district with a piece of cloth stuffed in her mouth.

Station house officer of Mitauli police station Anil Kumar Saini said, “An FIR was registered against unidentified accused under IPC section 302 (murder). We are waiting for the post-mortem report to ascertain the cause of death and to confirm whether she was raped. If the report confirms rape, we will add relevant sections to the FIR. Further investigation is on.”

Police said the girl had gone to the field on Wednesday but did not return home. Villagers found her semi-naked body on Thursday morning.

On receiving information, police arrived at the scene and sent the body for postmortem. Police suspected that the girl was strangled.

Title: Cops cuff truck driver on charge of murder
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Pune: A 48-year-old truck driver was arrested on Wednesday on the charge of stabbing his co-worker to death after a petty quarrel in the cabin of a truck parked along the Mumbai-Pune highway in Vadgaon Maval.

The Vadgaon Maval police have identified the deceased driver as Bankelal Gaud (38) of Madhya Pradesh. The suspect, Rakesh Yadav, of Madhya Pradesh has been charged under Section 302 (murder) of the Indian Penal Code.

The police said the incident occurred when Gaud and Yadav were on their way to Ahmednagar from Mumbai. “They parked the truck at Vadgaon-Talegaon Phata along the highway and began cooking food inside the cabin. This is when they entered into a brawl over some issue and in a fit of rage, Yadav stabbed Gaud in his chest, killing him instantly,” an officer from the Vadgaon Maval police said.

After the murder, Yadav informed the police that someone had murdered Gaud. “However, during sustained questioning, Yadav spilled the beans, leading to his arrest,” the officer said.

Title: Chennai Metro rail set to gobble up more parks, Amma canteen
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Greater Chennai Corporation has decided to give 12,722 square metres of land worth Rs 41.99 crore to Chennai Metro Rail Ltd (CMRL) for its phase-2 construction.

The land, owned by the civic body, includes an Amma canteen , two parks, an open playground with a basketball court and gym and a portion of a road. Apart from the cost of the land, CMRL would have to bear the cost of re-constructing these facilities at another location as well as take permission from the government wherever more than 5% of open land is being transferred.

The decision was taken in the corporation council meeting in November, details of which were uploaded on the civic body’s website on Thursday. The corporation does not have an elected council for the past four years. Its commissioner G Prakash is the special officer. According to the documents, six parcels of corporation’s land would be given.

In zone 6, the corporation has decided to give 657 square metres of land permanently for construction of Ayanavaram station. This includes corporation’s ward building and a portion of a road. The cost of this portion is Rs 1.18 crore.

In zone 13, CMRL will be get 1,203 square metres of land, which is a third of Dr Muthulakshmi Reddy park that the civic body opened in 2010. The corporation will give the land to CMRL on the condition that the park be brought back to its original condition after construction is over. It is likely that the Aavin booth operating at the park will also be removed. The cost of this land parcel is Rs 12.14 crore.

In zone 6, the corporation has decided to give two more parcels of land for construction of Perambur Market metro station. Of this, 42 square metres accommodates an Amma canteen, which CMRL would have to relocate to another location. In ward 70, metro rail will be given 1,361 square metres permanently and 2,515 square metres on a temporary basis. This land abuts a portion of the Murasoli Maran park, which the transport agency would have to refurbish after construction is over. The corporation has also directed that CMRL construct a building for them. These parcels would cost Rs 21.56 lakh and Rs 6.5 crore.

In Zone 9, for construction of Tirumailai metro station, a shopping complex-cum-toilet over 108 square metre run by the corporation will be given to metro rail for Rs 1.55 crore. CMRL will have to replace and rebuild the complex.

In the zone, CMRL will be get 1,751 square metres permanently and 5,224 square metre temporarily for construction of Greenways Road metro station. This is the biggest land parcel covering a basketball court, an open playground, a gym and a portion of KVB Garden park. This will cost CMRL Rs 20.4 crore.

Title: Body found with throat slit in Ujjain
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative Image

UJJAIN: Body of a man was found with his throat slit in the jungles of Rohalkhurd village in Ujjain district on Thursday.

Deceased Manohar Bhati, 35, had left his house on Wednesday night. His mobile phone was operational till 9.30 pm, ASP (rural) Akash Bhuria said.

His family went to check the fields when he did not return home in the night and found his bloodied body, he said.

Bhati’s throat was slashed. Police found empty liquor bottles indicating that he was with some people drinking in the area before he was killed.

Investigators found his blood-stained t-shirt, around 500 m away from his body, Bhuria said. Police have registered a case of murder and sent the body for the postmortem.

Police have rounded up eight suspects and were in the process of questioning them, he said.

Title: NMC gets a week to clear Don Bosco Rd
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: The Bombay high court on Thursday directed municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game to remove all the illegal encroachments from the Don Bosco Road within a week.

The bench comprising Justices S Kathawala and Milind Jadhav gave the directions to Game, who was present before the court for hearing a writ petition filed by parents of two school students. The petitioners were seeking a direction to the civic body to make the Don Bosco Road area hawker-free as five educational institutes, including a hostel, were located there.

In the affidavit submitted before the court, Game said the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) had finalised free hawking zones and restricted zones based on the norms finalised by the civic administration’s general body. But the Don Bosco Road was not included in the resolution of general body or in any of its subsequent orders.

In the affidavit, Game said then divisional officer Nitin Ner had granted temporary permission to the hawkers to ply their business on the Don Bosco Road without the permission or the knowledge of the municipal commissioner.

“The divisional officer has already been suspended for certain other illegalities committed by him with regard to encroachments in other places. Moreover, a show-cause notice has been served to the divisional officer for granting permission to the hawkers on Don Bosco road. An enquiry is to be conducted against him,” stated the affidavit quoting Game.

During the last hearing on February 17, the court was peeved with the civic body for seeking more time to make the road free from hawkers. The court had then directed the municipal commissioner to be personally present during the hearing on Thursday.

Sachin Shinde, the lawyer representing the petitioners said, “The court has ordered the NMC to remove illegal hawkers and encroachments near the schools within a week. Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game has also submitted an affidavit to the court promising to make the area near schools free of hawkers within a week.”

Game told TOI, “We have told the court that we will take another week to remove the encroachments and make the area free of hawkers.”

The court has also directed the city police to ensure that hawkers do not return and start doing business once the civic administrations evicts them.

Title: Two held for killing four of a family
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Rajahmundry: The Rajahmundry urban district police arrested two people accused of killing four people by setting a house on fire on January 21 at Dulla village in East Godavari district. Speaking to the media, SP Shemushi Bajpai said that the two accused— Masada Srinu and Marlapudi Mohan of Muramanda village set the house on fire after locking the house from outside which led to the death of Kotni Satyavathi (50), Kotni Ramu (16), Ganta Durga Bhavani (30) and Ganta Vijaya Lakshmi (5).

According to the police, Satyavathi had promised her nephew Masada Srinu that she would give him her daughter’s hand in marriage and taken Rs 1 lakh in exchange. But she later decided to call off the marriage. Later that week, Srinu poured petrol on the people and set them ablaze. He then bolted the door from outside.

Title: Jamia News: Jamia Millia Islamia’s students demand release of ‘political prisoners’
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Anti- CAA protesters are detained by the police at UP Bhawan

NEW DELHI: Students of Jamia Millia Islamia ’s Joint Coordination Committee protested outside UP Bhavan on Thursday, opposing the alleged slapping of Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) and National Security Act (NSA) on the people involved in anti-CAA/NRC agitations. Several of the protesters were detained and taken to Mandir Marg police station.

Among those detained by the police were around 40 students and a few locals, who have been sitting on a protest outside the Jamia campus’ gate number 7 since December 15. A 15-year-old local, Faizan, was also detained.

JCC said that they also protested against the UP government and demanded the release of former Gorakhpur hospital doctor, Kafeel Khan.

“Innocent people are being thrown into jails. They are being slapped with draconian laws such as UAPA, NSA and others. We demand that all political prisoners be released without delay. When state turns rogue, who is going to protect the rights of the citizens?” asked the committee.

“Police were aware of the protest and as soon as the students and locals gathered near UP Bhavan, the cops detained them and started putting them in buses. They were taken to Mandir Marg police station,” said JCC member Raghib Naushad.

Another JCC member Safoora Zargar claimed that the detained protesters were not provided food for some time at the police station and they were also not given a bus to go back to Jamia.

When contacted, a senior officer of Delhi Police said: “A few people were detained during the protests at UP Bhavan, who were released after some time.”

Title: Govt appoints Simhachalam trust board
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The state government has appointed a new trust board to run the Simhachalam Devasthanam. The newly-nominated trust board consists of 16 members including hereditary trustees and the chief priest who is known as ‘Pradhana Archaka’.

The hereditary trustees of the temple are the Pusapati Gajapathi Raju family from Vizianagaram. Currently, the hereditary trustee is P Ashok Gajapathi Raju, former Union minister of civil aviation. One of the nominated members is also from the Pusapati family— Sanchita Gajapathi Raju, daughter of former hereditary trustee Pusapati Ananda Ganjapathi Raju.

Welcoming the state government’s move, P Ashok Gajapathi Raju— the hereditary trustee said, “It’s always good to have more people dedicated to the purpose of running the Devasthanam on board. We did not have a board for quite some time. This is a welcome move.”

The government passed the order on February 19. The board will be chaired by the founder family member, while the chief priest Gopala Krishnamacharyulu will be an ex-officio member.

Title: Dhatwada locals oppose pipeline work
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

PONDA: Following opposition to work on a pipeline at Dhatwada-Usgao in Ponda, superintending engineer of the water resources department (WRD) Pramod Badami carried out an inspection of the site on Wednesday and tried to placate villagers.

WRD claims that so far, just one person has agreed to let them run the underground pipeline through his land.

The department had intended to start work on this land first, until the rest are onboard. Villagers, however, threatened to agitate if the WRD begins the project. Vasudev Gaude, secretary of the Dhatwada-Usgao Citizen Forum, said they would protest at the site.

WRD is laying a 1,000mm pipeline to facilitate augmentation of the Khandepar river during summer using water from the Ganjem water scheme on the Mhadei. The Opa water works complex, catering to Ponda and Tiswadi, is dependent on the Khandepar.

Title: Delhi Rain: Delhi likely to witness more rain on Friday
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: After isolated light rain and thundershowers on late Thursday night, Delhi is likely to see more rain on Friday but it will stay scattered, the weatherman predicted on Thursday.

“On Friday, a partly cloudy sky is expected with light rain or thundershowers. Strong surface winds (25-30km per hour) during the day are expected. The maximum and minimum temperatures will be around 24 and 13 degrees Celsius, respectively,” a meteorological official said.

On Thursday, the maximum and minimum temperatures were 27.5 and 13.6, both three notches above normal, the official added.

According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), between Thursday and Saturday, scattered-to-fairly widespread rain and thundershowers are expected over Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Uttar Pradesh. “It has already started raining in Haryana. The maximum temperature of 26-27 degrees Celsius may go down to 23-24,” said Kuldeep Srivastava, head of the IMD’s regional forecasting centre at Delhi.

Thursday was also a windy day. While the average speed was 25km per hour, there were also gusty spells of up to 40km per hour. The windspeed will decrease from Saturday, Srivastava added.

In terms of pollution, the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) readings showed the air quality index at 230 in the poor category. On the CPCB index, an AQI of 0-50 is considered “good”, 51-100 “satisfactory”, 101-200 “moderate”, 201-300 “poor”, 301-400 “very poor” and 401-500 “severe”.

According to CPCB’s central control room data, while Delhi’s average PM2.5 was 98 micrograms per cubic metre at 7pm on Thursday, the average PM10 was 219.5. The safe standards for both pollutants are 60 and 100 micrograms per cubic metre, respectively, and their “emergency” benchmark under the Graded Response Action Plan, which has been chalked out to tackle air pollution in the national capital region, is 300 and 500.

According to SAFAR, a central weather forecast agency, the scattered rainfall, under the influence of a western disturbance, will improve AQI to the moderate category by Friday. But a marginal deterioration to the poor category has been forecast for Saturday while by Sunday, AQI is likely to slide into the higher end of “poor” to “very poor”, said SAFAR.

Title: Salem Accident: Six Nepal pilgrims killed in van-bus collision in Salem
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

The minibus was heading to Rajasthan via Salem

SALEM: Six pilgrims from Nepal, two of them women, were killed and 25 others injured after an omnibus rammed a minibus near Omalur here in the early hours of Thursday.

District superintendent of police (SP) Deepa Ganigar said they had alerted the kin of the deceased through Nepal embassy in Chennai and they were expected to reach the city on Friday morning to receive the bodies.

According to the officer, the accident took place when the minibus, with a total of 34 Nepalese on board, was heading to Rajasthan via Salem after visiting Kanyakumari. “They had come down to the country to visit Hindu temples.”

When the minibus reached Naripallam on Salem-Bengaluru National Highway around 1am on Thursday, the officer said, passengers asked the driver to stop the vehicle for them to refresh.

Beemla Chowdry, 40, one of the passengers said, “We were travelling continuously for more than 10 hours and we wanted to take rest for a while. So, we asked the driver to park the vehicle near a stone mandapam belonging to a Kalilamman temple on the highway.”

Driver Gowlram Chowdhari subsequently parked the minibus on roadside and a few of them approached the night security at the temple, seeking permission to stay there for a few hours.

The SP said, “After obtaining permission from the security guard, they asked the driver to come to the stone mandapam. Chowdhari moved the minibus without noticing the omnibus that was coming in from the opposite direction. While the omnibus driver tried his best to avoid collision with the minibus, he didn’t succeed and hit the bus carrying the pilgrims at the centre, killing four of them on the spot and injuring others.”

She said the omnibus was heading to Kerala from Bengaluru and the passengers in that vehicle escaped unhurt.

When alerted by other motorists on the stretch, the Omalur police took the injured to the Salem Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College and Hospital. The SP also reached the accident spot and oversaw the investigation.

“While Ber Bathur Rai, 46, Tikaram, 50, Gopal Taman, 53 and Bodhini, 50 died on the spot, Bulkari Cowdhri, 50, and Vishnu Thangal, 55, died in the hospital without responding to the treatment. The remaining passengers are out of danger,” the officer said.

Collector S A Raman, meanwhile, visited the injured at the government hospital and consoled them.

The Omalur police have registered a case under Sections 279 (rash driving or riding on a public way) and 304 (a) (causing death by negligence) of Indian Penal Code and further inquiry is on. They are, however, yet to make any arrest.

Title: No end to manual scavenging in Trichy
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

A sanitary worker entering a manhole of UGD chamber in Trichy

TRICHY: The tall claims and promises by authorities on eradicating manual scavenging in Trichy city are nothing but a lie as the practice of deploying humans inside manholes to clean clogs in the underground drainage (UGD) chambers is still plevalent. Trichy City Corporation has never given priority to finding a solution to end the inhuman and dangerous practice.

About 35% of Trichy city is covered under sewage network through 60,000 houses and commercial UGD connections. Residents who dump sanitary napkins, diapers and even vessels in the sewers cause blockages of the UGD lines. The corporation uses a sewer jetting machine mounted on a truck or a mini-load van to clear the block. The machines using water pressure will remove the blockages in sewers. But to fix the machine’s nozzle at the exact location of the clog, sanitary workers have to enter the UGD chamber.

"Getting into the UGD chamber and coming into contact with faecal waste amounts to manual scavenging. If entering the chamber is inevitable, all safety gear should be used to avoid contact with the waste," a city-based expert in sewage management said.

A total of 12-15 such manual scavengers hired through private contractors are employed in the four zones of the corporation for the purpose. But the corporation has never tried to find an alternative to this practice or to make the inevitable job safe. Kumbakonam municipality had purchased a semi-automatic robot to clean the UGD chambers, but no such machine was purchased for Trichy city.

Officials said that the automatic sewer cleaning machine like the one in Kumbakonam will only do vertical cleaning. For horizontal cleaning such as removal of blockages in sewers, most of the civic bodies still rely on the manual scavengers. "We have planned to study the super sucker machine used in Chennai for safe cleaning of UGD blockages. A suitable machine will be purchased," a senior official with Trichy City Corporation said.

Title: Pothole repairs to start this month
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

New Delhi: Come April and the capital may largely be free of pothole-ridden stretches with the public works department (PWD) going to start a resurfacing project, which was ordered by the previous Delhi government. The Rs 320-crore project will start by the end of this month.

A few of the worst-affected areas are Badarpur, Mathura Road, Ashram, Najafgarh and Raja Garden while the Rao Tula Ram Marg, IIT and Munirka flyovers have also developed huge potholes. Potholes are often responsible for accidents, many of which prove to be fatal.

A senior government official said PWD would resurface all roads coming under its jurisdiction by early April. The agency will first test the strength of a road before resurfacing it by removing potholes and other obstructions.

The government wants to minimise the number of accidents to the maximum extent possible, said another official. As the construction ban has been fully lifted, PWD will soon start its work and a sizeable portion is likely to be covered by mid-March, he added. The areas with heavy traffic flow will be taken up first.

The official said the government had received multiple complaints from commuters across the city regarding potholes on several patches, which led to the compilation of a list of such stretches before the assembly elections. The damaged footpaths will also be repaired.

Once the resurfacing is done, PWD may also look at the stretches with several traffic bottlenecks. For smooth movement, especially during peak hours, the agency will try to add a single lane on both sides of such stretches wherever possible.

A survey of the PWD roads was carried out last October to identify the stretches with potholes, irregular surfaces and damaged medians. As many as 50 MLAs, along with 50 assistant engineers, went around their constituencies and clicked photos of damaged roads, which were later uploaded on a mobile application created by Delhi government to track potholes.

Title: Performance of lawyers to be reviewed
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: The handling of the Don Bosco Road case has prompted the civic administration to review the performance of 26 empanelled lawyers.

On Thursday, NMC chief Radhakrishna Game had to be present for a Bombay HC hearing. This was his second summons to the HC in 22 days. In January, he was summoned in a case related to outsourcing of sanitation work.

Sources said there is a feeling that a section of NMC’s lawyers are unable to argue cases properly. “I am going to review the performances of all our empanelled lawyers. If required, we will revamp the panel,” Game told TOI.

The 26 lawyers are divided into three panels — one for Supreme Court cases, one for Bombay HC and a third one for district court cases.

“The HC panel has five senior and two juniors. NMC pays Rs 35,000 per case to senior lawyers and Rs 20,000 to junior lawyers. They are paid the case ends,” NMC sources said. The panel for Nashik district court has 12 senior (Rs 12,000) and 5 junior lawyers (Rs 5,000). There are two lawyers in the SC panel. NMC pays Rs 12,000 when there is an important hearing and Rs 50,000 on the final hearing. Till December 2018, there were 2,042 cases pending with three courts.

Title: Ex-VC of MKU elected to Madras University VC search panel
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Madras University

CHENNAI: P Maruthamuthu , former vice-chancellor of Madurai Kamaraj University , was elected senate nominee to the Madras University ’s vice-chancellor search panel on Thursday.

With his nomination, now the search panel has two former VCs. The governor-chancellor has to appoint his nominee to complete the search panel for selecting the new vice-chancellor.

Last week, the Madras University syndicate had nominated P Ramasamy, former vice-chancellor of Alagappa University, to the search panel.

During the special senate meeting convened to elect a nominee to the search panel, the two associations in Madras University — professors forum of Madras University and Madras University teachers association (MUTA) — nominated Maruthamuthu and M Anandakrishnan, former vice-chancellor of Anna University, to the search panel. Following the two proposals, the senate conducted voting to choose its nominee. “Out of the 87 votes polled on Thursday, Maruthamuthu got 65 votes and Anandkrishnan got 21. One vote was not valid,” a senate member said.The three-year tenure of vice-chancellor P Duraisamy is coming to an end in May.

In 2016, following the disappearance and non-cooperation of R Surendira Prasad, former member of the Madras University VC search panel , the state government had brought an amendment fixing minimum qualification for search panel members and time limit to shortlist VC candidates.

Title: ‘Women panel funds not to be diverted’
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: Mayor Satish Kulkarni on Thursday pulled up the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) officials for diverting the funds allocated to the women and child welfare committee. He told the officials that the designated funds should be made available only for works proposed by the committee.

On Thursday, the mayor held a meeting with the civic officials and the members of NMC’s women and child welfare committee. The meeting came against the backdrop of the committee’s allegations that the administration had been diverting its funds for past three years.

Kulkarni said the budgetary provision for the committee last year was Rs 22 crore, but the administration used the funds on different works. “I have given directives to use the funds for works proposed by the committee,” said the Kulkarni.

The meeting was attended by Hemlata Kandekar, the chairperson of the committee, and other panel members. Officials from the civic body included additional commissioners B J Sonkamble and Sandip Nalawade, and city engineer Sanjay Ghuge.

It has also been decided that the NMC’s community halls will be used to organise Haat Bazaar on weekends.

Title: Govt looks to expand mohalla clinic reach
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

New Delhi: Delhi government is all set to expand the network of mohalla clinics in a mission mode. The aim is to ensure that the primary healthcare facility reaches all the residents in their neighbourhood. The government is planning to open 351 clinics by April this year.

At a meeting held at Delhi Secretariat on Thursday, health minister Satyendar Jain reviewed the status of the existing clinics and directed the authorities present to expand the network of the healthcare facility in the national capital. Jain also ordered installation of CCTV cameras inside the diagnostic labs to keep an eye on malpractices. The authorities have been instructed to regularly monitor the availability of medicines.

It was noted in the review meeting that the number of patients visiting mohalla clinics was rapidly growing. It prompted the health minister to emphasise on the need to digitise prescriptions for diagnostic tests through test referral reports. “Digitisation of prescriptions and reports will smoothen the functioning of the centres. As the state-run healthcare facilities expand in number, the monitoring system too will need regular upgrading,” Jain stated in the meeting.

Mohalla clinics have been one of the most talked about projects of the AAP government. The model has already been emulated by a few states. Kiran Mazumdar Shaw, Biocon CMD, had on Wednesday described the mohalla clinic facility as a step in the right direction towards achieving the sustainable development goal of universal health coverage.

After visiting the facility in Saket, she had tweeted: “Just visited a mohalla clinic in Saket, Delhi, which was most impressive. Neat and clean and very efficient. I spoke to the people who said it was a boon for the mohalla. Need to replicate this model across the country.” In a video message, she added that she was very impressed with the way it is conceived.

Over 450 mohalla clinics have been opened so far in Delhi. In its previous term, the government had planned to open 1,000 such clinics, but it could not materialise mainly due to the tussle with Centre and issues related to availability of land. Aam Aadmi Party has recently promised in its 10-point guarantee card that holistic healthcare facilities will be provided to every family through mohalla clinics and state-of-the-art hospitals.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Maoists extend support to protesting tribals
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: Maoists in Visakha-East division have extended their support to agitating tribals who have been protesting for the protection of tribal acts. The banned outfit recently condemned a petition filed in the high court by the leader of a business association challenging the 1/70 Act. Aruna, secretary of Visakha-East division committee of CPI(Maoist) demanded that the government remove illegal structures constructed by non-tribals in Agency areas and register cases against them.

The Maoist leader said in her statement that the chief minister has not retracted cases filed against tribals who were involved in agitations against bauxite mining. “Why is the government oppressing tribals who have occupied coffee plantations of APDC?” she asked. Aruna further alleged, “Jagan is two steps ahead of N Chandrababu Naidu is terms of benefitting MNCs by inviting foreign investments and handing over the state’s natural resources.”

Title: Red-faced Bommai admits he did not personally apologise to Guha
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Bengaluru: Home minister Basavaraj Bommai was left fumbling and embarrassed on Thursday when historian Ramachandra Guha denied that he (Bommai) had called to him (Guha) to offer an apology after he was manhandled by police during a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in December last year.

Lambasted by the opposition over the government’s handling of protests against CAA, Bommai had claimed on the floor of the house on Wednesday that he had personally apologized to Guha. But the writer, in a two-part tweet on Thursday, said, "The Home Minister of Karnataka has claimed on the floor of the state Assembly that he apologised to me by phone for the manhandling by the Bengaluru police on 19th December 2019. This is false. I received no such call or apology."

Guha went on to say: "Even if such an apology had been offered, I would have rejected it. The imposition of Section 144 was illegal (as the Karnataka High Court has since held) and I was proud to be one of thousands of peaceful protesters who defied the State’s arbitrary action on that day."

Caught on the wrong foot, Bommai mumbled through an explanation. He told TOI that he intended to say he had apologised "to Guha and others in a public speech" and not in person.

"I wanted to say that I had called MLAs UT Khader and Tanveer Sait to alert them about anti-national elements. And I wanted to add that I even apologised to Guha in public. It got it all mixed up," Bommai said.

On Wednesday, while apologising to former speaker KR Ramesh Kumar for the notice Mangaluru police had served on him when he tried to enter the city despite a ban, Bommai said he had personally apologised to Guha.

The claim came in reply to a discussion on a series of developments in the state after CAA was enacted. Two people were killed in Mangaluru when police opened fire on a group protesting against CAA, while police have used prohibitory orders to muzzle protests across the state.

Guha had participated in a protest in front of Town Hall in Bengaluru on December 19, which was in defiance of prohibitory orders imposed by the police. He was pushed around by cops who were attempting to disperse protesters. The Karnataka high court has since held the prohibitory orders issued by the police was "illegal and unsustainable".

Title: Chennai corporation to conduct recruitment through TNPSC
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Greater Chennai Corporation has decided to fill its vacancies through the Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission ( TNPSC ), against the current practice of choosing candidates through the district employment exchange.

A decision to this effect was made in the November 2019 council meeting, resolutions of which were uploaded on the corporation website on Thursday. The civic body has not had an elected council in place for four years. Corporation commissioner G Prakash is the special officer. Currently, the corporation has 805 vacancies for various positions.

According to official documents, the corporation has decided that vacancies in its medical department will be filled through the state medical services commission.

Until recently, vacancies for the posts of engineers were filled through the employment exchange. In the latest instance of the corporation conducting recruitment directly, the results were not released due to administrative reasons.

However, the corporation said that in other parts of the state, vacancies are filled through the TNSPC, which conducts the exams in a professional and systematic manner. Whenever vacancies arise, TNPSC fills it in a phased manner, the corporation said. The civic body does not have a similar infrastructure to conduct examinations, it said in the resolution. However, this decision of the civic body would have to be ratified by the state government.

Apart from this, the corporation continues to fill posts through appointments on compassionate ground, where relatives of employees who die during work are given jobs.

As per data, there are around 100 vacancies for the post of assistant, 98 for assistant engineer (civil), 83 for license inspector, 53 for typists, 35 for wireman and so on. There are 90 vacancies in the sanitary inspector cadre, but the government is framing rules for the same, the resolution added.

A senior official said that recruitment through TNPSC would bring down the average age of corporation employees. For instance, candidates recruited through the employment exchange are hired according to the date of enrolment. Assistant engineers aged more than 40 have also been recruited recently. “However, through TNPSC, fresh college candidates will be recruited,” the official said.

Title: Arvind kejriwal: Release funds to civic bodies, Goel tells CM
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

New Delhi: Senior BJP leader Vijay Goel on Thursday urged chief minister Arvind Kejriwal to immediately release funds due to the municipal corporations and implement Ayushman Bharat health scheme.

Addressing a press conference, Goel welcomed Kejriwal’s talk of cooperation with the Centre and said that BJP will extend “creative cooperation” to the AAP government for holistic development of Delhi. “I hope Kejriwal will implement good things he talked about at his swearing-in ceremony,” he added.

AAP did not react to Goel’s statements.

Goel said believing Kejriwal’s words that he will treat everyone impartially, he would like to urge him to pay the dues to the municipal corporations. “Kejriwal said that he never treated anyone in step-motherly fashion. We request him to stop his step-motherly attitude towards the municipal corporations and release approximately Rs 10,000 crore due to them.”

“If he wants to cooperate with the Centre, he should immediately implement Ayushman Bharat scheme and PM Awas Yojna. Also, he should try to solve the problem of dirty water supply by taking help of the Centre and civic bodies ,” the Rajya Sabha member added.

He asked the CM to meet Lok Sabha members from Delhi at regular intervals and also hold his Janta Darbar.

Title: Veligonda project: CM sets August deadline for first phase completion
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Markapuram: Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Thursday set a new deadline for completion of the first phase of Veligonda project.

Directing officials to complete it by August 2020 and release water to the ayucut, he made it clear that there should not be any more delays in completing the works as it has already been delayed by a decade due to the negligence of the previous government. He also asked officials and contractors to ensure the speedy completion of the second phase of the prestigious project.

Jagan, who inspected the project in Prakasam district and held a review meeting with officials, public representatives and contractors, said the contractor should plan the works in such a way that they should complete the first phase for water release by August.

“Only 600 metres of first tunnel work was completed during the five-year rule of the TDP. I will not allow such tardy progress,” he said.

In response to the CM’s directive, executives of contracting firm said they were completing at least 200 metres of tunnel work per month and hope to reach the target by June-July itself. Expressing his satisfaction over completion of 1,400 metres of tunnel work in the last eight months, the CM asked them to further expedite the work. He also wanted to know why work on only 410 metres on the second tunnel was completed during the TDP regime.

He also asked district collector Pola Bhaskar as to why the head regulator work was not progressing as per schedule. The collector explained that land acquisition process picked up momentum only in the last few months and they would complete it by March 31 to enable the speedy construction of the head regulator. The government had replaced the contractor of the head regulator as the previous agency failed to put it on fast track. The new contractors promised the chief minister to complete the works as per the deadline fixed by the department. Work on the head regulator as well as the second tunnel work would be completed within four months, they said, adding that they have launched tunnel boring works from both sides to complete the project ahead of schedule.

Jagan also agreed to revise the relief and rehabilitation package for the project affected. He asked irrigation officials to explore the feasibility to look into the request of education minister Adimulapu Suresh to dig a new channel at T5 block to provide irrigation water to about 11,500 acres in Pullalacheruvu mandal. He responded positively to the minister’s request to spare Rs 70 crore to complete the channel as it would benefit local farmers.

The CM also directed officials to consider the request of Kandukur legislator Manugunta Mahidhar Reddy to give water to Rallapadu reservoir from Veligonda eastern canal. Ministers Anil Kumar Yadav, Balineni Srinivas Reddy, A Suresh, Pinipe Viswaroop, special chief secretary Adityanath Das, MLAs Nagarjuna Reddy, Sudhakar Babu, Venugopal, Anna Rambabu and MP Magunta Srinivasula Reddy were also present at the review meeting.

Title: Mill owners agree to hike fixed rate for tapioca
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Salem: The sago mill owners have agreed to increase the fixed rate for tapioca procured from farmers during a tripartite meeting held at the collectorate in the city on Thursday. The meeting was chaired by district collector S A Raman. When farmers demanded the mill owners to increase the fixed rate for tapioca based on the quality of the starch, the latter agreed to that. The collector asked sago producers to stop using banned chemicals to bleach sago into ‘milk’ white using pressure pumps. tnn

Title: 6-year-old grandson richer than ex-CM Naidu by Rs 16 crore
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

AMARAVATI: Former Andhra Pradesh CM and TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu continues to be poorer than his 6-year-old grandson Nara Devansh for the second consecutive year. Devansh is richer than his grandfather by nearly Rs 15.6 crore in terms of assets.

Keeping with the family’s practice, Naidu’s son Lokesh disclosed his assets and liabilities of all other family members — Naidu, the ex-CM’s wife Bhuvaneswari, his wife Brahmani and their son Devansh — for the ninth consecutive year.

Naidu grew richer by about Rs 87 lakh as his net assets touched Rs 3.87 crore but his liabilities stood at Rs 5.13 crore on account of a housing loan. Bhuvaneswari, who heads the family’s Heritage business, saw an increase of over Rs 8 crore in her fortune with the net assets being Rs 39.58 crore.

Interestingly, Lokesh said he became poorer by Rs 2 crore compared to last year as the value of his net assets shrunk to Rs 19 crore. His liabilities stood at Rs 5. 70 crore. His son Devansh is now richer than Lokesh with net assets of Rs 19.42 crore without any liabilities. Lokesh’s wife Brahmani too became richer by over Rs 4.5 crore since last year, with net assets of Rs 11.51 crore.

Title: City theatre groups shine at state event for disabled kids
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nashik: Two Nashik city-based theatre groups have bagged two prizes at the state-level drama competition for disabled children organised by the state cultural department.

The second prize was won by Rachna Vidyalaya’s play titled ‘Destiny..?’, while the third prize was bagged by ‘Mukt Mi’ staged by Bhavna Chandak Maha-NAB School for the Blind.

Mumbai theatre group Rotary Sanskardham Charitable Trust’s ‘Manku Makde’ won the top honour at the competition.

Dhananjay Wable, the writer-director of ‘Destiny..?’, said, “We had an opportunity to mirror social challenges on the stage. The children had no stage fright at all. They were eager to know how they performed.”

Mukteshwar Munshettiwar, the chairman of Maha-NAB, said “Participating in such competitions improves the students’ personalities. Coming third in the state is a moment of pride for us.”

The competition had taken place in the city on February 13, 14 and 15, and 12 teams from across the state had participated.

The Nashik district had also stood third in the state-level Sanskrit drama competition. ‘Manjula’, a play by city-based group Krupa Shaikshanik Samajik Sanstha bagged the third prize. The plays were performed between February 20 and 29 at Pune, Mumbai, Nagpur and Nashik.

Title: Corporator raises a stink over garbage collection
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020
