“The ruling dispensation isn’t interested in the findings, but only wants to confuse the people. Once NIA has taken over the probe, there is no need for another probe. The NIA has concrete evidence against the accused and therefore the CM has heeded to its request,” Fadnavis told TOI.

The ex-CM was in the city after being summoned by the chief judicial magistrate’s (CJM) court.

Fadnavis said the two complaints against him mentioned by the applicant were of private nature, including defamation. “Those were filed over a protest for public causes of slum dwellers in Gokulpeth area, back in 1996-97 and in 2003. Now, both cases have been disposed of.”

Explaining the first case, the southwest Nagpur MLA said it was filed when he went to save slums from getting demolished, since he was corporator of that area. “Since it was related to a land of a former government lawyer, he had filed defamation case against me. The other one is related to tax payment over ULC surplus land, which was again a private one.”

He said that his lawyers, who prepared his affidavit in 2014, told him that only cases which could have impacted the polls should be disclosed. “In all five assembly elections, I won with over 50% majority. So there is no question of any impact of private complaints. In fact, I had also sought information under the RTI Act from cops regarding cases filed against me, and even they failed to mention these two complaints. But they’re not at fault as they were never discussed for nearly two decades from 1996 to 2014,” he said.

Speaking on Maha Vikas Aghadi ’s (MVA) loan waiver scheme, the opposition leader said it was an extension of the schemes launched by the BJP government with some changes. “We will be cornering the ruling dispensation on various farmers related issues, including the loan waiver,” he said.

Title: 300 youths from 14 states participate in NIC
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nagpur: Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan (NYKS), an autonomous organisation under the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports (MoYAS), has organised National Integration Camp (NIC) under Ek Bharat Shreshth Bharat Campaign at Mission India Campus, Khadgaon Road, here, between February 21 and 25. Around 300 youths from 14 states have come together to showcase their cultural talent at the NIC camp.

The participants have come from Assam, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, Goa, Odisha, Punjab, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Jharkhand, Chhatisgarh, Diu and Daman and Maharashtra. The camp is organised to showcase unity in diversity of India through ‘Ek Bharat Shreshth Bharat’ theme.

Member of Parliaments Krupal Tumane and Dr Vikas Mahatme will formally inaugurate the camp at 11.30 am on February 22.

Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre (EZCC), Ministry of Culture, has also organised cultural programmes of 47 folk dance troupe, craftsperson and authentic Odia cuisines for this programme since Maharashtra is paired with Odisha under ‘Ek Bharat Shreshta Bharat’ campaign. The programmes by EZCC are slated to be organised between February 23 and 25 in Mission India Campus.

In the first session, the youth from different states gave introduction about themselves as well as their states and culture. All the participants planted saplings and took oath to protect and conserve the environment.

In the ‘Feel India’ session, representatives of the cultural teams from four states— Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Assam and Odisha— gave information about their states and explained about the culture and speciality of their respective states.

After the ‘Feel India’ session, all the participants came together to display their cultural specialities of their states through exhibition wherein they showcased their traditional attires and other important cultural aspects. After the exhibition, a cultural programme was organised wherein the participants showcased their talent in folk dance and folk songs.

Sharad Salunkhe, Deputy Director, NYKS for Maharashtra and Goa; Hitendra Vaidya, District Youth Co-ordinator, NYKS of Bhandara; Udayvir Singh, District Youth Co-ordinator, NYKS of Nagpur, Snehal Basutkar, District Youth Co-ordinator of NYKS of Amravati, Shivdhan Sharma, District Youth Co-ordinator, NYKS of Wardha, Shruti Dongare, District Youth Co-ordinator, NYKS of Gondia took efforts for the camp.

Title: KSRTC bus tragedy: PM Modi, Tamil Nadu CM extend condolences
Content:
19 people including five women were killed when a container truck rammed into Kerala bound bus near Avinashi i... Read More

Extremely anguished by the bus accident in Tamil Nadu’s Tiruppur district. In this hour of grief, my thoughts and p… https://t.co/0pZlytSsjP — PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1582182699000

Pained at the tragic loss of lives in a bus accident in Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu. My heartfelt condolences to families… https://t.co/oXGHStHbIq — Om Birla (@ombirlakota) 1582189610000

Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, external affairs minister S Jaishankar, governor Banwarilal Purohit, chief ministers of Tamil Nadu and Kerala have condoled the death of passengers in two accidents in the state.“Extremely anguished by the bus accident ... In this hour of grief, my thoughts and prayers are with the bereaved families. I hope those who are injured recover at the earliest,” tweeted the Prime Minister.“Pained at the tragic loss of lives in a bus accident in Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu. My heartfelt condolences to families of the deceased & prayers for the speedy recovery of those injured in the accident,” tweeted the speaker.Tamil Nadu governor Banwarilal Purohit and chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami condoled the death.“I am shocked and grieved to hear about the accident occurred early morning between Kerala State Transport Corporation bus and a container lorry causing death of 20 persons and heavy injuries to others near Avinashi of Tirupur district,” the governor said.I convey my deep condolences to the bereaved members of the families. I pray to God to rest departed souls in peace and to give strength to their families to overcome this unfathomable loss. I also pray to God for speedy recovery of all the injured, the governor said in a statement.Palaniswami read out a statement in the assembly condoling the death. “The accident occurred after the container truck’s front tyre burst and the driver lost control and ramming the Kerala Transport bus,” Palaniswami said.He said in another accident, six Nepalis on way to Rajasthan met with an accident in Krishnagiri district. “Several others who were injured have been admitted in hospital,” Palaniswami said.

Title: ‘Good morning’, ‘Have a nice day’ forwardsflood cops’ WhatsApp interactive groups
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Kolkata: Meaningless messages, images and GIF forwards on WhatsApp groups created by Bidhannagar Police as a mode of daily interaction between Salt Lake residents and local cops, senior police officers have started texting block representatives to ask group members to refrain from posting such forwards that ultimately override important messages.

Set up in September last year, after a meeting between Salt Lake block representatives and senior officers of Bidhannagar Commissionerate led by police commissioner LN Meena, cops had formed separate WhatsApp groups for 50 odd blocks in Salt Lake with the officer in charge of local police station, a sub-inspector and president, secretary, treasure, assistant secretaries and vice-presidents of the blocks as group admins. One member from each household in the block was added as a group member. Each group has anything between 150 and 250 odd members.

“The main idea behind the formation of the group was to disseminate information to general public as well as a channel where residents can directly speak of their grievances and report traffic-related issues or illegal activities in their area directly to cops. However, everyday the groups get flooded with random messages. At times, people stop checking the groups, which can ultimately lead to some important information among a cluster of forwards go missing. Hence we have asked the group members to refrain from sending forwards,” said a senior police officer.

A police officer, who is also an admin in one of the groups, said may people forward these messages to everyone in their contact list at one go. “Most of them do not realise that such messages are a nuisance and cause inconvenience to others,” he said.

Prodded by the cops, the group admins have started sending out messages stating: “This is to inform you that this group has been created to highlight any law-and-order problem in your neighbourhood. Request members to refrain from posting messages not relevant to the group.”

“The group has been extremely useful. Time and again, we point out problems related to traffic and other problems in blocks and lanes and cops do take action. The cops also inform any issue of importance via this group. But such has been the barrage of useless messages that several members I know have put this group on ‘mute’ mode, missing out important information. We have requested members to refrain from posting unrelated messages but they seldom listen,” said Basab Aich, the president of BE Block Residents’ Association.

Title: Nagpur: Regularize 1,800 daily wagesanitary workers says Mayor Sandip Joshi
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Mayor Sandip Joshi ordered to regularize 1,800 contractual sanitary workers who have completed 20 years of ... Read More NAGPUR: Mayor Sandip Joshi ordered to regularize 1,800 contractual sanitary workers who have completed 20 years of service and has also directed to adjust all the 315 surplus teachers in other civic-run schools. Both the orders were fallout of unanimous decisions by both ruling and opposition corporators demanding the House to regularize all the 4,407 daily wagers sanitary workers as the administration had stopped their absorption citing financial crisis. Besides, the administration informed the House that due to some errors it could not regularize all of them and said that papers of 1,800 daily wage sanitary workers were found OK. The mayor directed the administration to give appointment letters to 1,800 daily wage sanitary workers on March 2, the foundation day of the NMC. Corporators also said that most of the schools in the city — either run by the civic body or zilla parishad — are witnessing dropouts and as a result schools are being shut down every year. So no schools will absorb surplus NMC teachers. Instead, the NMC should adjust them only in its schools. The mayor also directed the administration to initiate the process to convert six Marathi medium schools into English state board patterns. The mayor also directed the administration to start the process to convert three schools into CBSE pattern as suggested by civic chief Tukaram Mundhe .

Title: Colva: Man accused of killing wife acquitted
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

COLVA: Bihar native Shyamsunder Pandey , 36, accused of murdering his wife in 2018, was acquitted by South Goa principal district and sessions judge B P Deshpande.

In her complaint on December 6, 2018, Zuarinagar resident Sajeena Yashodharan had stated that the accused, who had been residing in accommodation rented out by her, had poured kerosene on his wife, Sangita Devi , 36, and set her ablaze.

Pandey, who had fled, was subsequently nabbed at Vasco railway station. He was charged with murder by the Verna police when Devi succumbed to her injuries five days later .

After recording the examination of 11 witnesses in support of the prosecution’s case, Pandey was acquitted.TNN

Title: Coimbatore bus tragedy: Ministers, MP from Kerala rushed to accident spot
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

19 people were killed when a container truck rammed into Kerala bound bus in Tirupur district

COIMBATORE: Soon after the news about the accident at Avinashi broke, Kerala minister for transport AK Saseendran and minister for agriculture VS Sunil Kumar, Palakkad district collector D Balamurali and Palakkad MP VK Sreekandan along with several officials visited the accident spot.

More than 10 ambulances from Palakkad reached Tirupur to transport the victims. Sunilkumar said he hoped that the Tamil Nadu government would take stringent action against the truck driver.

Saseendran visited Tirupur government hospital and consoled the family members of the victims. Addressing to reporters, he said that the Kerala government would give Rs 10 lakh each to the family members of the deceased through KSRTC insurance and Rs 2 lakh as initial amount from the government.

Families of the two staff of the KSRTC, who lost their lives in the accident, will get Rs 30 lakh each. He also appreciated the Tirupur and Palakkad district collectors for their immediate rescue work.

Sunil Kumar said 50 people, including two drivers, were travelling in the KSRTC omni bus. The driver of the truck had dozed off for few seconds and lost control of the vehicle leading to the accident, he added.

“We hope that the Tamil Nadu state government would take stringent action against the truck driver,” he added.

Title: Global int’l film fest in Gangtok from Feb 28
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Kolkata: The Film Federation of India (FFI) and Sikkim Film Cooperative Society Ltd (SFCSL), in association with the Sikkim government, are organising the second chapter of the Global International Film Festival. The three-day-long festival will begin in Gangtok on February 28 and will be the first international film festival of its kind in Sikkim.

According to FFI president Firdausul Hasan, this carries forward the initiative to take international film festivals to tier 2 and 3 cities across India and promote those places as shooting destinations. “We had a good response in the first edition in Siliguri. Many attended the festival. The Sikkim government approached us. Incidentally, Sikkim is coming up with a film policy and want to have a film industry of their own,” Hasan said.

Apart from screening of 20 feature and 20 non-feature movies at Manan Kendra Screen I and II, the festival will also host workshops/seminar by National Film Development Corporation (NFDC) as well as a fashion show. Azerbaijan will be the focus of this festival. “Cinema has the power to influence the masses. Keeping this in mind, the film section of the Information & Public Relations (I&PR) department is taking steps to evolve and engage in the industry,” said Namrata Thapa, secretary (IPR) of the Sikkim government.

Acclaimed cinematographer Vinod Pradhan will be conferred the Lifetime Achievement Award, while the festival’s inauguration will take place with ‘Every 68 Minutes’. “Dignitaries like Randhir Kapoor, Manisha Koirala, Padmini Kolhapure, Kamlesh Pandey, Rahul Rawail, Ashoke Viswanathan, Rituparna Sengupta, Arindam Sil, Payel Sarkar and Gargi Roychowdhury are expected to attend the event,” Hasan added.

Title: Supreme court admits Goa’s plea, but says notify tribunal award: Mhadei
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

Panaji: The Supreme Court, in an interim order on Thursday, directed the Centre to notify the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal ’s final award of August 14, 2018, but said it was subject to the outcome of the petitions filed by the riparian states—Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra—against the award.

The Supreme Court also admitted Goa government’s special leave petition challenging the award and posted it for final hearing on July 15, 16 and 24.

During the hearing, the Supreme Court bench comprising justices D Y Chandrachud and Hemant Gupta raised a technical point to ask how a state could challenge the award when it was not notified and does not have legal force, advocate general Devidas Pangam told TOI.

In its SLP, Goa has sought quashing of the tribunal’s award allotting 3.9tmc (thousand million cubic) ft water to Karnataka for drinking purpose.

Experts said that with the apex court likely to finalise the hearing within five months and deliver its verdict thereafter, it will not be easy for Karnataka to go ahead with its water diversion plan, especially as the apex court has made it clear that the award of the tribunal will be subject to its judgment.

While chief minister Pramod Sawant put out a terse tweet saying the matter has been fixed for July 15, Union minister and Dharwad MP Prahlad Joshi welcomed the order and said he has requested his colleague in charge of water resources Gajendra Singh Shekhawat to take steps and notify the tribunal award.

Karnataka, which has locked horns with Goa on the larger issue of sharing Mhadei water, had petitioned the tribunal seeking release of 7.56tmcft of water for Kalasa-Bhandura canal project. Goa opposed it, delaying notification of the tribunal order.

“The order is a major step in the long struggle of Karnataka for fair share of Mhadei waters. Once the tribunal award is notified, Karnataka can take up construction of drinking water project without hurdles,” a senior Karnataka water resources officer said.

In its petition, Goa has also asked for interim relief to stop Karnataka from proceeding with the construction of bunds at the Kalasa nullah in Kankumbi, and to restrain it from diverting water from the Mhadei basin to the Malaprabha basin.

Goa had taken objection to the yield of the Mhadei basin calculated by the tribunal, as its plea for the exclusion of a catchment area of 509sqkm from the coastal region was not considered.

The state had argued that, due to tidal action, a part of the Mhadei in the coastal region is affected by salinity and that some of the catchment drains directly into the sea without rainwater collecting in the river.

In August 2018, the three-decade old dispute between the three states over sharing of the Mhadei water ended with the tribunal rejecting Karnataka’s demand for 36.5tmc ft of water and allotted it only 13.4tmc ft, including 3.9tmc ft for drinking purposes through diversions, against its demand for 7.5tmc ft.

But the tribunal also made it clear that diversion would be permitted only during the five monsoon months—from June 1 to October 31. “Even if some inflows are observed into the reservoir(s) during the non-monsoon period, no diversion is permitted out of the inflow during the non-monsoon period starting from November 1 to May 31,” the tribunal headed by justice J M Panchal had observed.

Title: FATF Pakistan News: Pak stays on FATF grey list, sees June deadline on terror, could slip into black list after June
Content:
Pak Prime Minister Imran Khan. (AFP)

NEW DELHI: Pakistan has will stay on the FATF grey list until June 2020, after which it could slip into the blacklist, As the global body to fight terror financing wound up its plenary in Paris, Pakistan has been told it could go into the blacklist if it failed to complete its 27-point action plan, diplomatic sources told TOI.Of particular concern to FATF is Pakistan’s failure to make significant progress in prosecuting and penalising terrorist financing. If Pakistan fails to take credible action by June, the FATF has warned that it could call on its members and urging all jurisdiction to advise their financial institutions to give special attention to business relations and transactions with Pakistan. As in the October 2019 plenary, the language used is identical to that used on Iran , which is currently in the blacklist.Pakistan and the Imran Khan-led government had promised to its people that they could get out of the greylist in February. Pakistan stayed out of the blacklist with three countries, China, Malaysia and Turkey, speaking out for it. But to get out of the greylist, Pakistan needed 13 countries to vouch for its efforts. Pakistan had lobbied hard, and many countries would have spoken in its favour. But on technical grounds at least, with evidence of money trail that put a lie to its claims, Pakistan could not claim clemency.Pakistan had arrested hafiz Saeed of LET days before the FATF plenary to show commitment. ON Thursday, Pakistan was told that it had to convincingly prosecute and convict the top leaders of all terrorism groups as mentioned in the Action Plan, sources said.This could put Imran Khan and Pakistan’s ISI in a spot, with their credibility coming under serious question, even within the country.Specifically, Pakistan has been asked to show action on eight following areas:First, demonstrate that remedial actions and sanctions are applied in cases of anti-money-laundering/terror-financing violations, relating to terrorist financing (TF) risk management.Second, Pakistan has to show that “competent authorities” are cooperating and taking action to identify and take enforcement action against illegal money or value transfer services (MVTS).Third, It has to demonstrate implementation of cross-border currency and bearer-negotiatiable instruments (BNI) controls at all ports of entry, including imposing effective sanctions.Fourth, Pakistan has to demonstrate that law enforcement agencies (LEAs) are identifying and investigating the widest range of TF (terror financing ) activity and that TF investigations and prosecutions target designated persons and entities, and those acting on behalf or at the direction of the designated persons or entities.Fifth, it has to show that TF prosecutions result in effective, proportionate and dissuasive sanctions; sixth, implement targeted financial sanctions (supported by a comprehensive legal obligation) against all 1267 and 1373 designated terrorists and those acting for or on their behalf, including preventing the raising and moving of funds, identifying and freezing assets (movable and immovable), and prohibiting access to funds and financial services.Seven, it has to demonstrate enforcement against TFS violations including administrative and criminal penalties and provincial and federal authorities cooperating on enforcement cases.Eight, Pakistan has to show that facilities and services owned or controlled by designated person are deprived of their resources and the usage of the resources.In Video: Terror funding bites back as Pakistan stays on FATF grey list, gets June 2020 deadline

Title: Zilla panchayat poll schedule likely today, Goa government notifies reservations
Content:
Representative image

PANAJI: The state election commission (SEC) is likely to announce the schedule for the March 22 zilla panchayat elections on Friday.State election commissioner R K Srivastava, on Thursday, confirmed receipt of the notification reserving constituencies for ZP elections. “I have received the notification from the government regarding reservation of constituencies signed by secretary panchayat,” Srivastava said.Declining to comment on when the election code of conduct will come into force, he said, “We are working on the schedule.”For the 50 constituencies, 17 seats are likely to be reserved for women, around 14 for OBCs, six for STs and one or two for SCs.Sources said that SEC had been waiting for the notification from the panchayat ministry to prepare and announce the election schedule. On Wednesday, panchayat minister Mauvin Godinho had said that he had sent the file on the ZP polls to SEC. Srivastava said the notification was received on Thursday evening.SEC is holding a press conference on Friday where it is likely to announce the election schedule. The date from which the code of conduct will come into force and the election date will also be announced officially, sources said.The cabinet meeting scheduled for Friday will also discuss the issue of the code of conduct that will come into force for the polls as it will impact some important decisions till then.The opposition has criticised the chief minister for declaring the poll date (March 22) as they felt it should have been announced by the election commission and not the government.As elections are to be contested on political lines, 50 seats, 25 each in North Goa and South Goa zilla panchayats, are at stake.The BJP government has been criticised, first, for deferring ZP election, and then over delays in finalising reservation of the constituencies.The election will be a litmus test for Sawant who, so far, has had a smooth sailing. Though he enjoys a majority in the House of 40, his party’s performance as well as his will be closely watched with two years to go before assembly polls, political observers said.It must be noted that BJP candidates had done badly in the 2015 ZP polls that were held just two years after the party’s thumping success in the March 2012 assembly polls.

Title: Vasco: Sada gets machines to treat garbage
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

VASCO: The Mormugao Municipal Council (MMC) on Thursday installed machines to treat 1.5 lakh cubic metres of waste dumped at Sada. The treatment process will take around six months.

Minister for waste management Michael Lobo, who launched the machines, said the treated wet waste would be sent to Karnataka for electricity generation.

Transportation of such waste to Karnataka would cost the Goa government Rs 22,000 per truck, he said, even as he announced that the state would soon have plants of it own that would use wet waste to generate electricity.

The minister also said that waste management plants are in the process of being set up in many parts of the state.

He said that although people object to the establishment of such plants due to apprehensions of foul smell, odours are generated only when garbage is accumulated for days. “Such dumps are actually threats because an epidemic can break out at any time,” he said.

Mormugao MLA Milind Naik, who was also present at the launch, said garbage from all of MMC’s 25 wards is being dumped at Sada, creating problems for residents and hospitals located area.

Title: ‘Education must be imparted in mother tongue’
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nagpur: “Mother tongue is very important as it is the language of our Soul- Our thought processes emotions and feelings. It is also the language we learn from the time we are in our mother’s womb. Scientists over the world agree that education should be imparted to children in their mother tongues for proper learning. Everyone should respect his/her mother tongue and try to nurture it by speaking, reading and writing in a pure form,” stressed Amruta Indurkar, assistant professor from department of Marathi, PGTD, Rashtrasant Tukdoji Maharaj Nagpur University.

Indurkar was speaking at the event organized to mark ‘Matru-Bhasha Diwas’ at G.S. College of Commerce and Economics on February 20. The event was organized following directions from the Ministry of Human Resources Department under the EBSB (Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat) scheme.

Dr. P.M. Paradkar, Nodal Officer of EBSB, welcomed Indurkar. Head of department of Languages Swati Kathaley presided over the programme. Rendition of Rashtrasant Tukdoji Maharaj Vidyapeeth Geet was done. Beautiful and melodious Marathi Bhavgeets were presented by students of the College namely Rajesh Kudave, Adarsh Kolamkar, Atharva Pande, Ameya Pimplapure and Chinmayee Dongre, with accompaniment on tabla and harmonium.

Paradkar urged the students to respect all languages but by paying special attention in learning towards their own mother tongues. “Our great literature in various Indian languages should be read by the students.”

Kathaley also guided the students.

A grand book exhibition on Marathi Literature was also organized. Indurkar inaugurated the exhibition in the college’s library.

The programme was attended in large numbers by students, teachers and members of office staff. The program was conducted by convener of EBSB Deoyani Chavan and vote of thanks was proposed by Sonali Gadekar.

The success of the program was possible because of the best wishes of principal Dr. N.Y. Khandait. Professors Akash Jain and Pallavi Srivastava worked hard for the success of the programme.

IQAC Coordinator Prof. P.J.Yadao, Dr. N.D. Dharmadhikari, , Dr.S.S.Gadekar, Dr S. D. More, Prof. Madhuri Purohit, Prof. Dr. Neha Kalyani and other teachers were prominently present in the programme.

Title: Goa government nod for 9th onshore casino
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Chief minister Pramod Sawant

PANAJI: The state government has granted permission to open a casino in a starred hotel at Kadamba plateau. Home department sources said that it would be the ninth onshore casino in the state.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant cleared the file to start the 29-table 100-capacity gaming club. It will have 17 electronic card games, four roulettes, five slot machines and a money wheel. The total occupied area is below 300 sqm.

The government had earlier granted 11 licences to onshore casinos out of which three shut after the government hiked various licence fees in March 2018.

Out of the nine casinos, eight are being operated in North Goa. While the state government has capped the number for offshore casinos, there is no such restriction on granting licence to onshore casinos so long as they meet the government criteria.

From February 1, Goans have been banned from entering gambling areas in casinos, except those working on them.

The state government had appointed gaming commissioner to monitor the operations of casinos and to check if Goans are going to the gaming facility.

The state government has yet to come out with the rules for the functioning of gaming commissioner. Sources said that the gaming commissioner rules files have been sent to law department for vetting before it is notified.

In June 2015, the home department had first drafted the rules in which there was a provision to arrest any person under 21 entering casinos.

It was in June 2012 that the state government passed the amendment to the Goa Public Gaming Act, 1976 by introducing the Goa Public Gaming (Amendment) Bill, 2012.

Title: FSSAI sets limits for formaldehyde in 63 fish species
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The limits of formaldehyde for 63 species of marine and fresh water fish have already been set by the food safety and standards authority of India (FSSAI), New Delhi.

The food safety and standards (FSS) (Food Products Standards and Food Additives) Regulations, 2011, are being amended to add ‘Limit of Formaldehyde’- the naturally occurring formaldehyde for 63 different species of fish, the FSSAI informed the high court of Bombay at Goa on Thursday.

“The amount of naturally-occurring formaldehyde for 63 species has been laid down under sub-regulation 2.6.2 of FSS Amendment Regulations, 2020,” assistant director of FSSAI Pankaj Gera submitted to the high court.

During the hearing on Thursday, counsel representing FSSAI, Dattaprasad Lawande, told the court that a total of 693 samples of fish have been analysed till date by the Central Institute of Fisheries Technology (CIFT), Kochi to determine the naturally-occurring formaldehyde in fish.

On the request of petitioners that no checks of formalin in fish are being carried out, the high court asked the government to place the reports of random checks before it. Senior counsel J E Coelho Pereira told the division bench that the laboratory to test the presence of formaldehyde in fish at the SGPDA market in Margao, should in fact be set up at the wholesale market.

Under its Rs 54 lakh collaborative research project ‘Natural level of formaldehyde in freshly harvested fin fish and shellfish’ initiated on July 3 last year, the FSSAI is expected to set formaldehyde standards for 72 major commercial species of fish which contribute to more than 90 percent of the fish production and consumption in India.

The central authority is expected to complete the exercise by August this year after analysing more than 1,000 samples of fish.

Title: Trump Ahmedabad Visit: 9km of roads closed for Donald Trump-Modi show
Content:
US president Donald Trump (REUTERS photo)

AHMEDABAD: As US president Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be holding a road show and an event at the Sardar Patel stadium in Motera, seven stretches of road measuring about 9km, will be closed for the general public from 8am on February 24 till the event ends.Joint commissioner of police J R Mothalia said the road between Janpath T junction and Motera T junction will be closed. The roads between New CG Road, Sangath Mall and Motera stadium , between Koteshwar T junction and Krupa Residency, between Devarsh Flats and the club house in Motera and from Bhat Circle to Koteshwar Crossroads will remain closed.To avoid these roads, people can go from Apollo Circle to Janpath T junction and they can also go towards Sardar Patel Ring Road through the Motera T junction.The road between Noble T junction, Indira Bridge Circle and Airport Circle will be closed and people can take the alternative route towards Nana Chiloda Ring Road, Galaxy Underbridge and Naroda Patia.The stretch between Shahibaug Dafnala and Airport Circle will also be closed and people will able to commute between Ghevar Circle and Shahibaug underpass.Mothalia said 2,800 ST buses, 4,000 cars and 35,000 two-wheelers are likely to come for the event. For these vehicles, parking will be given according to the participants’ district and parking facilities will be available 2km from the airport.

Title: Inter College in Almora reserves principal’s post for Methodist, High court stays appointment process
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

NAINITAL: The Uttarakhand high court (HC) on Thursday put on hold the appointment process of principal in Almora’s Adams Girls Inter College.

A bench comprising Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan and Justice Ramesh Chandra Khulbe was hearing a petition which alleged that the institution is a government-aided college and therefore, it cannot restrict appointments of various posts for one religion or any specific section of a religion. The petition said applications were sought for the principal post, but later they were informed only a Methodist could be appointed to the post.

"The petitioner filed the application but she was later informed that only a Methodist can be appointed to the post. She was left with no option but to approach the court," said Harendra Belwal, the counsel appearing for Preeti Lal, the petitioner.

While the institution argued in the court that the right to choose the principal rests with them since the college is a minority institution, the court did not agree with the argument. The court said that an unaided institution may be free to put such procedure in place for the appointment, but not in this case as the institution is government aided. The court said that the condition put forward “does not accord with law.” "As to whether such institutions are entitled to confine the appointment to the post of principal in its college only to a particular sect of Christians, excluding others including Christians who do not belong to that particular section, necessitates examination… We are prima facie of the view that such a condition stipulated by the fifth respondent (the institution) does not accord with law," the court said.

The high court stayed the appointment of the new principal and has given the college three weeks’ time to file its response.

Title: Govt to set up a board to buoy investments in state
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Reacting to the 100% exemption of stamp duty on transfer of sick units, the micro, small and medium enterprises in the state said the Budget addressed their long-pending demand. However, in case of auction of sick units, the duty will be calculated on sale price of the immovable property.

Presenting the Budget, the chief minister announced that the government would bring in an amnesty scheme to give100% waiver of interest and penalty payable on stamp duty. The government will also create an online facility for payment of stamp duty provided on loan documents executed by banks and NBFCs.

To boost industrialization and enhance ease of doing business, the chief minister proposed to launch a new single window clearance policy which would be renamed as ‘One Stop Shop’. Gehlot has in the past said the current single window policy suffered from many inefficiencies and the government wanted to plug the gaps.

In order to fast-track investment proposals and push industrialisation, the government will set up a board of investment. Since this new government came to power, there has been no new big investments even though the MSME Act has attracted lots of proposals.

Gehlot announced that 16 new industrial zones would be established. But there are many industrial areas already announced but has not been developed. Many industrialists said the government did not allocate any money for Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor, which needs funds urgently to acquire land.

Title: Dehradun: Despite CM’s order, only one minister turns up at assembly office
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

CM Trivendra Singh Rawat

DEHRADUN: A few days ago, CM Trivendra Singh Rawat had announced that he would be present in the assembly office on Wednesdays and Thursdays and also directed his cabinet ministers to be present as well to listen to people’s grievances.

However, despite the CM’s directive, not a single minister turned up on Wednesday. Transport minister Yashpal Arya was the only minister to come to the assembly building on Thursday.

The CM meanwhile came to the assembly building on both days to meet the people. A communique from the CM’s office said that the chief minister interacted with numerous people including physically challenged persons who acquainted him of the problems they are facing. When queried about the absence of ministers, the CM told mediapersons, “Most ministers are currently out of station or busy on assignments in their respective constituencies. We expect a better turnout from next week.”

Transport minister Yashpal Arya said that it was a good exercise to solve public grievances. “As far as I am concerned, I devote my maximum time to people in my office as well as constituency,” he said.

Opposition Congress, however, did not fail to take potshots at the ruling party over the issue. Congress state vice-president Suryakant Dhasmana said, “This makes two things clear. Firstly, the BJP ministers do not take the chief minister seriously, and secondly, that they are not bothered about people and public -related issues.”

Title: Mysuru Kannada Habba to enthral citizens
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Mysuru: Vijaya Karnataka, a sister publication of The Times of India, will organise Mysuru Kannada Habba on Sunday.

Various events have been lined up as part of the festival which will be held between 10am and 10pm at Kalamandira.

Major and medium industries minister Jagadish Shettar will inaugurate the festival. Pramoda Devi of Mysuru royal family will preside over the event. Writer Vasudhendra, and YD Rajanna, president, district Kannada Sahithya Parishat, will be the chief guests. Ranjeet Kate, CEO, Vijaya Karnataka and Bangalore Mirror, Harish Konemane, editor, Vijaya Karnataka will pbe resent.

Datta Vijayananda Tirtha Swamiji of Sri Ganapathy Sachchidananda Ashrama will grace the event. District minister V Somanna will deliver the valedictory address. MLA S R Mahesh and BV Vasanth Kumar, chairman, Karnataka Sahithya Academy, will be the chief guests.

The valedictory will be held at 5.15pm.

Events:

As part of the event, numerous cultural activities will be held. In the morning at 9.30am, a procession of folk troupes will start at Kote Anjaneya temple on the palace premises. Writer Kalegowda Nagavara will inaugurate the procession. DCP (law and order) AN Prakash Gowda will be the chief guest.

A documentary ‘Wild Karnataka’ will be screened at 2pm at Kalamandir.

Social activist HV Rajeev and artist Badal Nanjundaswamy will inaugurate an art exhibition of artists and photographers at Suchitra Art Gallery. Music event by Anur Anantakrishna Sharma and students, discussion on the future of Mysuru, theatre songs by Disha and team of Natana, solo drum performance by Rachana Mysuru, fashion show by designer Jayanti Ballal and team, dance show by Vidwan Shridhar Jain and team, programme by humorist Gangavati Pranesh, Narasimha Joshi and Basavaraj Mahamani, will be the major attractions.

At Vanaranga, Chinnara Chilipili event will be inaugurated by actor, director Mandya Ramesh at 12 noon. VS Mallikarjuna Swamy, joint director, Rangayana and AIISH Director M. Pushpavati will be the chief guests.

The other highlights include book exhibitions, food outlets, art and craft, and exhibition.

Title: Mandi magic to bring back farm charm?
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

The state government has proposed to set up 44 new mandis to promote agriculture produce. These will be opened in a phased manner across Rajasthan.

With an allocation of Rs 3,420 crore in the Budet, the government is set to provide various facilities to the farmers, including 25,000 solar pumps for which Rs 267 crore has been allotted. Last year, there was acute shortage of urea because of which farmers had to suffer. This year, the government has allotted Rs 30 crore to develop advanced storage facilities of two lakh tonne urea and one lakh tonne DAP in the state.

CM Ashok Gehlot said, “Providing better facilities to the farmers so that they can sell their produce easily is our prime goal.”

In 2019, state’s farmers had to face heavy losses due to excessive rainfall. To make the produce of the farmers risk free, the government has announced to bring Rajasthan State Agriculture Produce (Promotion and Facilitation) Act, 2020, and Rajasthan Agriculture Produce Contract Farming and Services (Promotion and Facilitation) Act, 2020. The government will try to increase the production of quality seeds certified by Rajasthan State Seed Corporation Ltd from eight lakh quintals to 12 lakh quintals. Moreover, 200 seed distribution outlets will be established in different mandis of the state.

Looking at the popularity of the drip and sprinkler irrigation in the state, the government has announced to introduce this method in 30,000 hectares for which Rs 91 crore has been allotted. Under the Agricultural University Jodhpur, a new centre for dairy technology and agricultural engineering will be established. Around Rs 5 crore has been allotted for the purpose.

Title: Madhya Pradesh CM opens model gaushala, says cow shelters will be income creators
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

CM Kamal Nath feeds a cow after inaugurating the ‘model gaushala’ in Chhindwara

BHOPAL: Chief minister Kamal Nath on Friday inaugurated a ‘model gaushala’ in Umarhar village of Chhindwara and said that his government is working not only for protection of cows but with the goal that ‘gaushalas’ become a means of generating income in rural areas.

“Cowsheds are being constructed in all panchayat headquarters across the state. We fulfilled the promise made in the manifesto soon after formation of the government,” Nath said.

Addressing a public meeting there, the CM attacked PM Narendra Modi and former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. “For 13 years, Shivraj Singh Chouhan made false promises and announcements. And PM Modi misled people in the name of nationalism. But people now know the truth. I believe in work, not in making announcements,” he said.

Nath said he will never let down the people of Chhindwara, a Lok Sabha constituency he represented for nine terms in Parliament. “Chhindwara will never have to be ashamed because of me. Be proud, thump your chest and say you belong to Chhindwara,” he told the cheering crowd.

The Umarhar cow shelter has been built by the state government at a cost of Rs 30 lakh. CM Nath reiterated his government is committed to protection of cows. Along with promoting organic farming with ‘gaumutra’ (cow urine) and cow dung, marketing of various cow products will also be promoted. Chhindwara district will get 31 such cow shelters, he said.

“The government is working with a new attitude and approach for development, and Chhindwara model has been made the basis for that progress. An investment-friendly environment has been created for generation of employment, which has started yielding results. For this, process related to establishment of industry have been simplified. This has increased the confidence of investors in Madhya Pradesh,” he said.

A day earlier, the Nath cabinet passed a bill for time-bound clearances of investment proposals, which is expected to boost industrialization and employment generation. When it becomes an Act, it will be the first such in the country, say sources in the government.

On Friday. the chief minister said that efforts are on to improve the level of education to connect youth with employment and self-employment.

Chhindwara MP Nakul Nath — Kamal Nath’s son — and ministers Sukhdeo Panse and Lakhan Ganghoria attended the function.

Title: Manushi Chhillar: My training in classical dancing has definitely helped me for Prithviraj!’
Content: Miss World 2017, Manushi Chhillar will mark her debut with a period drama 'Prithviraj' starring Akshay Kumar . The film is based on the life of the great king Prithviraj Chauhan While Akshay plays the titular role, Manushi will be seen as the love of his life, Sanyogita . The former beauty queen has recently wrapped up the shooting of her first song of the film.Also, the young starlet is a trained Kuchipudi dancer and talking about her first song, she said, "My training in classical dancing when I was a child has definitely helped me for 'Prithviraj'. I’m thankful to my parents for pushing me to take up dancing then because today, when I have to perform these big songs, it wasn’t extremely exasperating and frustrating for me."Giving us the details about the song, “I was definitely overwhelmed seeing the scale and the dance steps that I had to perform but during my rehearsals, I started feeling confident. The old learning all came back to me and I was sure that I could pull through. These dance sequences have taken the life out of me but I think I have managed to deliver. I was happy that my director and choreographer were happy with my performance. That matters to me the most. I hope audiences appreciate my hard work and bless me because I have given it my best, given it my all."Manushi also thanks her gurus for pushing her and building her foundation in dancing. The beauty adds, “I wouldn’t have been able to perform if I didn’t have the learnings that my gurus gave me. All their hard work to better me as a dancer in my childhood is actually the reason why I enjoyed doing the song in 'Prithviraj'. So, all the credit goes to them for shaping me and moulding me constantly. I can’t thank them enough and I feel fortunate that I had the opportunity to learn from them.”The film has been slated for Diwali 2020 release.

Title: Mumbai: Five drunks harass female MD of firm, colleagues in car
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Five drunk men stopped the car of a female managing director of a production house and her three women colleagues when they were driving back to their Andheri West homes early on Thursday.

The men jumped out of a police van stationed a few metres from Oshiwara police station and stopped the car, claiming to be police informers , and made vague inquiries.

Ritika Bajaj, MD of the production house, took to Twitter to report the harassment. She tweeted: “Five Drunk Men in one police van - stopped us while driving back from a late-night shoot. They were not even wearing the uniform and were claiming to be Police Informers. And of course, they were trying hard to get money, or maybe more because the car had four women! Trying to do all kind of antics, of clicking pictures making videos to scare us and god knows what rubbish they were blabbering!”

Oshiwara police called Bajaj after reading the tweet to record her statement late on Thursday.

While Bajaj did not respond to TOI attempts to contact her. her friend Dharmesh Thakkar, a mediaperson, said, “It was a terrifying moment for Bajaj and her friends who were returning from a shoot in Goregaon. They were stopped around 3.45am on Thursday and the five men harassed them after getting out of a Mumbai police van at MegaMall junction near Oshiwara police station.”

Thakkar said her three colleagues had planned to take an autorickshaw but accompanied her after she insisted on dropping them home. “The women locked the doors of the car when the miscreants began to bang on it. They left only after the women began to scream,” he said. Some of the women clicked photographs of the men on their cellphones which Bajaj shared with the police.

After the police recorded her statement, Bajaj tweeted: “Thanks so much for full support everyone @MumbaiPolice reached out to me and The support received has sorted everything for me! I am happy that I live in a city where approaching police is easy and actions are taken quickly!” Oshiwara police senior inspector Dayanand Bangar confirmed they have recorded Bajaj’s statement and launched a probe into the incident.

Title: AMU Coordination committee students to go on indefinite hunger strike from today
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Agra: A group of students from Aligarh Muslim University Students’ Coordination Committee have decided to go on an indefinite hunger strike on Friday. Their strike is in support of eight demands including resignation of the vice-chancellor and the registrar.

Members of AMU Students’ Coordination Committee have been sitting on a dharna against CAA and NRC at Bab-E-Syed since December 16 - a day after violence erupted on the campus. They have also been demanding the resignation of VC, registrar and other university officials including proctor and DSW for failing to protect them from police brutality on December 15 last year.

Though the proctor of the university, Afifullah Khan, stepped down from his post on February 4, others are still working. Besides resignation of the varsity officials, other demands include handing over of CCTV footage of December 15 and FIR against police personnel for vandalism at Morrison court, assault of the hostel gate keeper and the ambulance driver.

Not only this, students expressed anger against the VC and registrar by painting graffiti on the campus walls near the protest site.

Title: Bhopal woman boxer fails dope test in Qatar
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Divya Pawar

BHOPAL: An international boxer from Bhopal, Divya Pawar, has failed a dope test in Qatar. The Madhya Pradesh sports department on Friday said the 17-year-old boxer was unaware that an energy drink she had taken had a banned substance.

Pawar had won gold at the International Golden Gloves Boxing Tournament in Serbia last year and a bronze at Asian Youth Boxing Championship in 2018. Sources say she tested positive for higenamine, a potentially harmful cardiovascular stimulant prohibited by World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).

Pawar hadn’t responded to TOI’s message till the report was filed.

Her sample was taken during a championship in Qatar last December and the results declared on Friday.

Sports director-in-charge Vinod Pradhan said: “She is a promising boxer. I am told that she took an energy drink from Bhopal before going to the Qatar championship last year. She says the energy drink specially mentioned it was ‘dope free’.”

Divya had informed the doping agency and deposited the bottle, he ssid. Divya’s coach Roshan Lal did not respond to TOI’s calls.

Title: Awaiting reply on clarification sought on NPR, says minister
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

R B Udayakumar

CHENNAI: The state government has sought clarification from the Centre on new questions added for carrying out the National Population Register ( NPR ) exercise, said revenue minister R B Udayakumar in the assembly on Thursday. “We are yet to receive reply,” he said.

The government has not yet fixed dates for rolling out NPR in Tamil Nadu, he said. The issue was raised in the zero hour by leader of the opposition M K Stalin . “While several state assemblies have passed resolutions against the Citizenship Amendment Act, you (speaker) are not allowing us to move such a resolution in the House. The state government should at least stop rolling out NPR because it is actually National Register for Citizens (NRC) in disguise,” said Stalin.

Udayakumar said in the new NPR format, four new queries regarding dates of birth and places of birth of parents of citizens, their mobile numbers, Aadhaar and driving licence details have been added. Those queries were not there in the 2010 NPR. “People need not show any documents as proof for their answers. Similarly, answering these questions is not mandatory,” said Udayakumar, who was seen taking inputs from chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami.

The minister accused the DMK of trying to mislead the people, especially Muslims, on CAA and NPR by creating a false narrative, all with a view to secure their votes. “We have assured people in the past, and once again, we assure them that CAA will not affect any Tamil citizen living in the state,” said the minister.

Stalin, however, said CAA was anti-constitutional and should be withdrawn. NPR is being planned to target Muslims and Lankan Tamils, he said. Officials raise doubts about claims of citizens who don’t answer queries in NPR. Queries regarding festivals in NPR are aimed at identifying the religion of citizens, he said and demanded that it should not be carried out in Tamil Nadu.

Accepting Palaniswami’s challenge to give the names of any Tamil Nadu citizen affected by CAA, Stalin said he was ready to provide the list of names if the government would give assurance that NPR would not be rolled out in the state. As no assurance was given by the government, the DMK staged a walkout.

Title: Haridwar: ‘Campaign launched to collect gold for Bal Mandir at Ayodhya’
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

HARIDWAR: To build a ‘golden temple ’ for ‘Ram Lala’ in Ayodhya, Param Dharm Sansad 1008, founded in 2018 by Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati has now launched a campaign to collect gold to the tune of 1,008 kg from seven lakh villages across the country.

“Of the total 1,008 kg, about 108 kg will be used for construction of ‘ Bal Mandir ’ to which Ram Lala is likely to be temporarily shifted. And the remaining 900 kg will be given to the Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra, the trust constituted by the government to build Ram temple at Ayodhya,” said Avimukteshwaranand, who is secretary of the Ramalaya Trust. The Trust was set up by Swaroopanand a few years ago.

Avimukteshwaranand claimed that in the government trust, no Shankaracharya or eminent seers have been included. “It is only dominated by RSS-VHP-BJP members. They are in too much of a haste to complete the temple construction so that they might reap its benefit in the 2024 parliamentary polls.”

According to the seer, the plan is to collect at least a gram of gold from each village under the ‘Ram Ram gram gram yojana’ for the ‘Bal Mandir’. “For collection of gold, people will be given authority letters,” he added.

Meanwhile, VHP zonal organising secretary Manoj Verma said on Thursday that the gold collection is Param Dharm Sansad’s own initiative. “The organisation itself will be responsible for any such collection as no appeal for any donation has yet been issued by the trust authorised by the Supreme Court for temple construction.”

VHP international vice-president and Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra general secretary Champat Rai called the gold collection “illegal”, as the declaration of the campaign was made before constituting the trust by the government as per the apex court’s order.

Title: Rs 100cr tailwind to propel tourism to new heights
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Tourism department found fresh wind in its sail after chief minister Ashok Gehlot announced to create a fund of Rs 100 crore to promote the sector. The industry breathed a sigh of relief as in the previous Budget, the chief minister had ignored the sector by not allocating enough funds for marketing and promotion.

Additionally, he said the government will announce an “Ease of Travelling in Rajasthan” policy. While he gave no details of the legislation, stakeholders in the industry said that it could be the policy the department is already working on.

Tourism has been a lifeline of the state’s economy which supports host of other sectors like handicraft, gem and jewellery, hospitality, etc. The state tourism department has found a new spring in its step after Jaipur was recognized by UNESCO as world heritage city. Additionally, the state tourism department has signed an agreement with the UNESCO to promote intangible heritage of the western Rajasthan.

“The Budgetary support was needed as the sector is facing now multiple headwinds. On the top of economic slowdown, the corona virus has also disrupted the flow of tourists. Marketing and promotion is the key to attracting tourists and the funds will come handy,” said a hotelier which has witnessed cancellations of groups due to corona virus.

The chief minister also allocated a Budget of Rs 4 crore to conserve and renovate four properties of Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation. Siliserh Lake Palace in Alwar, Castle Jhoomar Baori in Ranthambore, Gokul in Nathdwara and hotel Sarovar in Pushkar will be benefitted under the scheme.

Title: Songs based on love entertain audience
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Nagpur: Various forms of love were captured in a musical ‘Ek Duuje Ke Liye’ at a programme organized by Kaladalan to mark Valentine’s Day at Scientific Society Hall on Wednesday.

The programme started with ‘Ye toh sach hai ki bhagwan hai’ by Sarang Joshi, followed by ‘Ungli pakad ke tune’ by Anushka Kale. Sagar Madhumatke won the hearts by presenting ‘Phoolon ka taron ka sabka kehna hai’.

The next song, ‘Sola baras ki baali umar ko salam’ was nicely presented by Neeta Kerhalkar while Sanjeev Jagtap sang ‘Fir wahi raat’. ‘Yeh ishq hai’, performed by Samaira Kale, was received well by the audience. Duet ‘Tere chehre se nazar nahi hatati’, sung by Neeta Kerhalkar and Sanjeev, got repeated clapping.

Songs like ‘Ruk ja o dil deewane’, ‘Nazar na laag jaye’, ‘Hai Rama’, ‘Vada karo nahi chhodoge’, ‘Khullam khulla pyar karenge hum dono’, ‘Dekha ek khwaab’, ‘Aye mere humsafar’, ‘Hum bane tum bane’, ‘Jab chhaye mera jadoo’ and ‘Kya yahi pyar hai’, besides others.

The singers included Anushka Kale, Samaira Kale, Neeta Kerhalkar, Sanika Thakur, Chetan Elkunchwar, Sarang Joshi and Sanjeev Jagtap.

Vijay Jathe and Nasir Khan were the anchors. The programme was conceptualized by Madhavi Pande while the singers were trained by Madhumatke and Joshi.

The accompanying artistes were Robin William, Pawan Manwatkar, Mangesh Patle, Ashok Tokalwar, Raju Gajbhiye and Waduklar.

Additional commissioner of police Nilesh Bharne was the chief guest at the programme.

(Reporting by Rushabh Rathod)

Title: Donald Trump visit: Separate for roadshow, united at Motera
Content:
Rapid Action Force personnel patrol a road ahead of Donald Trump's visit in Ahmedabad

AHMEDABAD: US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi are set to address a gathering together on February 24 at the world’s largest cricket stadium — Sardar Patel stadium in the Motera area of the city — but police sources said that they may travel in separate motorcades.“Both the leaders will conduct roadshows between Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International airport in the city and the Motera stadium but it is not clear whether PM Modi and President Trump will travel in the same car or separate vehicles,” said special police commissioner, city crime branch, Ajay Tomar.When asked if they will be travelling in open vehicles, Tomar said that the two leaders will not use open vehicles.Even though the ministry of external affairs spokesperson Ravish Kumar and Gujarat chief minister Vijay Rupani did not mention about Trump’s visit to Sabarmati Ashram, Tomar said that he was not aware of any change in Trump’s itinerary. He was addressing reporters at the crime branch office here on Thursday.When asked about the number of people expected during the roadshow, Tomar said, “One should not take risk of giving any numbers. But I am sure that roads will be packed.” He said that the stadium has a capacity of 1.10 lakh people and the entry will be given until the stadium is fully occupied.On security arrangement, he said, “We will be utilizing an anti-drone system developed by DRDO to secure the roadshow route. Apart from police personnel on the ground, we will also deploy our men on the terraces of roadside houses.”Earlier, the police had said that more than 10,500 police personnel, led by 25 senior IPS officers, will be deployed for the roadshow security.Along with the local police, teams of the Rapid Action Force, the State Reserve Police Force, Chetak Commando and the Anti-Terrorist Squad would be deployed on strategic locations, said Tomar.He said that special arrangements will be done for some guests at the GMDC ground. These guests will be taken to the Motera stadium in a bus.The participants will be given water and buttermilk by Gujarat Cricket Association (GCA) and caps will be given to give protection from sunlight.

Title: Gujarat CM reviews Trump visit arrangements
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani

GANDHINAGAR: Chief minister Vijay Rupani held a high-level meeting in Gandhinagar on Thursday to review and finalize arrangements for the visit of US President Donald Trump on Monday. Senior secretaries apprised the CM of security and other arrangements being put in place for the roadshow and Motera stadium event of PM Modi and President Trump.

Minister of state for home, Pradipsinh Jadeja, who was present in the meeting, listed out the traffic control arrangements that have been put into place and also the plan to ensure smooth travel of over one lakh guests to the stadium on February 24.

The CM also sought details of the arrangements made by the state government and Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation to make the programme accessible to the masses.tnn

Title: Ganga crusader Padmavati gains consciousness at AIIMS-Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Ganga crusader Padmavati

DEHRADUN: Ganga crusader Padmavati , who was admitted at AIIMS Delhi since the past three days, has now gained consciousness and is able to recognise people, seers of the Matri Sadan ashram said on Thursday, adding that she continues to be on ventilator.

Doctors treating her, however, refrained from making any comment on her condition and have sought at least two more days before giving any opinion regarding her actual state. Her attendant at AIIMS, seer Dayanand, said that on regaining consciousness, Padmavati has now been put on sedatives.

“The doctors said that she is trying to remove the oxygen pipe on gaining consciousness. Maybe the pipes are making her uncomfortable and that is why she is reacting in this way.” Meanwhile, another seer of the ashram Aatmabodhanand who has also been fasting for a free-flowing Ganga has declared to quit drinking water from Wednesday evening, alleging that security given to Matri Sadan head Shivanand Saraswati has been removed. Aatmabodhanand has demanded removal of present SSP of Haridwar for this act. He is fasting since October 30, when Padmavati was taken to Doon Hospital forcibly.

Title: Rajasthan: Organ transplant to get a major boost
Content:
This story is from February 21, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday allocated Rs 14,533 crore to the health sector for developing infrastructure, enhancing human resources, improving delivery of services, reducing out-of-pocket expenditure and bringing new machines for diagnosis of diseases and functioning of organs.

This year, apart from focusing on Nirogi Rajasthan scheme, the state government has given impetus to organ transplant. As of now, Sawai Man Singh Hospital has facilities for organ retrieval from brain dead patients. Now, the state government will develop organ retrieval centres in Udaipur, Kota, Ajmer and Bikaner. Also, Jodhpur’s Mathuradas Mathur hospital has been authorised for organ transplant.

Gehlot has also proposed a gastro surgery department for developing liver transplant facility in SMS Hospital. For the purpose, the state government has already signed a MoU with the Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, New Delhi.
